description:
This place is hallel. I got the pastrami and it was fantastic! 
The people even speak Hebrew!!!!!! 
Wow I am impressed!
author: Alex R.

description: I've been coming to this place for years. The regular pour-over coffee is consistently perfect and the paninis never disappoint. Can't go wrong.
author: Ilya S.

description: I love their ginger bread it is so good and fluffy with the steamed vanilla milk. I usually get these on cold days but I bet they'd be good anydsy
author: Simone G.

description:
Best place in the city they have the best coffee ever lovely people 
Good place to hang out
author: Mohammad M.

description: Tired of claustrophobic, no electrical outlet, over priced, filthy coffee shops in the Sunset? Go the extra mile for an independent, large, airy place with lots of clean tables and plug ins for your wi-fi device. The coffees are made in a row one at a time and kick like San Francisco beans of yore. I recommend the $4.88 grilled cheese sandwich with delicious slightly-herbal crispy sourdough and perfectly melted ample cheese. The $4.75 garden bagel has just the right amount of high quality spread softened by a nicely toasted bagel of your choice with bite size vegetables stacked inside. Mouth watering food, strong coffee, industrious and respectful family staff and neighborhood regulars--it's my go to. Parking is best in the pretty neighborhood off Ashton.
author: Vince's S.

description:
Overall, I like foglifter. It's a chill place to hang out, the food is decent if boring, and the coffee is actually quite good. It's quiet and family friendly. Nice feel inside. 
Unfortunately The staff here changes once a year or so--which makes sense since I think they are usually students. But this current batch (Summer 2017) is rather awful. They are indifferent at best, rude at worst. Greeting customers kindly with a smile is pretty standard service 101. I really hope they all leave at the end of the summer. 
With Philz as new competition, the owner is going to have to hire or train better people. An update to the pastry selection wouldn't hurt either.

Update: I recently boosted my review after the latest round of employees, very nice and attentive bunch of folks now (Fall 2018).
author: J S.

description: Excellent area to break away from the hard knock life. I had a New Orleans Iced Coffee and hit the books here. Once you settle in, you'll feel very cozy. This place is totally NOT a hipster cafe and you may not have to worry about the same kind of City College folks. This place is serious.
author: Elvine V.

description: Ive lived in this neighborhood for 20 years and have seen this place change ownership several times. This time the new owner just updated the facade and the interior a little so they could raise the price on everything. Both drinks we ordered were watered down and cold (hot chocolate & chai). They were out of whip cream, which well known, is every child's favorite part. It still smells like mold at the front counter and its condiment area is still super cluttered, ugly, and unorganized. Everything looks broken. There's a sound system with no music playing and a tv with nothing on it. The flooring is all warped and even the lighting doesn't match. Different name and still as grungy as ever. Super disappointed...wont be coming here again. Should have gone down the block!
author: Alex C.

description: I had their lox but in a croissant. Delicious!!! Their latte was also the best I've had in years! Check this place out!
author: Julien N.

description:
It's sad how far this place has went down hill. This was one of my favorite coffee shops in the city when it opened a few years ago, friendly staff, a hands on owner and an overall good vibe. 
Now it's the most inconsistent coffee shop I got to. It's hit or miss with the staff, some make a decent latte while others burn the shit out of it. Same goes for the food, I just had a ham and cheese croissant and the outside was burnt while the inside was almost frozen.
If it wasn't for the awesome owner they would be getting 1 star. From now on I'll only go there while he's working since he actually cares about what he gives his customers.
author: travis m.

description: Nice neighborhood place with great coffee and a decent array of yummy food. Dedicated, hard working owner, staff is unfortunately less dedicated. Worth a visit, buy local.
author: MJ J.

description:
This has been my go to spot on the weekends. And today will be my last. This new employee refused to
make my usual breakfast item which I had been getting for years. She could not tell me why today she couldn't make it.  I did not catch her name. But she had a tattoo near her neck area.
author: Mase S.

description: This is a spot I'd never head to again if not for the location. Coffee tastes a bit burnt and wifi can be a bit spotty. Ambiance is ok.
author: Anastasia Z.

description: Great little cafe on Ocean with lots of seating and good music to study to. I'm not much of a coffee drinker but I am a fan of their chai tea lattes, smoothies and sandwiches. Most importantly, WiFi service is great here too!
author: Lauren P.

description:
I love this spot. It's light, airy, and the staff is really nice! 

Only constructive criticism: I would definitely go here more regularly if they offered a medium or light roast. They use a great brand of beans for their pour-overs and espresso, but only ever seem to have dark roasts--honestly didn't even know Sightglass did dark since most specialty roasters keep it on the lighter side (less burned)! Would love the option to have something a little brighter. 

Also, prices are a little prohibitive (egg on a bagel is like $7!) considering how many students go here. 

Still my favorite place in the neighborhood though. The owner seems like a very nice person. Thanks, Fog Lifter!
author: Nessa F.

description:
She was rude and disrespectful. Ordered a grilled chicken panini and waited 20 min before decided to go and ask what had happened. That's when she informed me that she had run out of chicken. Before I decide to go and get my order I saw another girl get 2 of them (2 grilled chicken chicken paninis) and she came in 10 min after I did. I think it is very disrespectful to complete someone else's order if they came in way after me.

Edit
Deleted the picture but I will be returning to speak with the manager of the place to talk about the disrespected service received
author: Enxhi T.

description: A cute cafe. I prefer drink a lot of coffee, but their Chair Tea Latte is really good. I like this location because it's close to City College. Also they have Wi-Fi and parking (a big plus). Nice stuff and friendly owner. They have a big selection of appetizers. It's a good place for spending your free time.
author: Vicki G.

description: I live near Fog Lifter and what a delight it is to have in the neighborhood.  Pure class, I'd describe it.  Such a tastefully created and beautiful interior.  I always like to go there, relax, have a cup of coffee, maybe get something to eat, and do some reading or writing.  And the people that work there are nice to my dogs when I bring them to sit outside.
author: Kai M.

description: Great place to come to, work and have a nice coffee! Awesome meeting place. WiFi is good & the new owner is pretty friendly! Clean restroom. Four stars because food has been off sometimes & coffee too but they have great salads!!
author: Aki G.

description: Great coffee - they do pour overs of Sight Glass coffee and sometimes stump town too. While the menu is somewhat minimalist with sandwiches and additional options, they make a lovely oatmeal in the morning. Great staff and atmosphere too!
author: Mike K.

description: Oustanding new place ,Sudents at City college I recommend everyon to check it out .the Boss is friendly ,kind and provide good service have the honor to meet him ,thanks  for his kindness and hospitality.Super.
author: Manny M.

description: Not only is their iced mocha amazing but their customer service is exceptional. This cozy cute cafe is on the corner of Ocean Ave and Ashton Ave in San Francisco. There is a warm feeling the minute you walk in and they also have beautiful paintings as well as reading materials. They also have a bench out in front and tables outside. This is a great way to start my day.
author: Lisa A.

description: Friendly staff. I was there when someone was training and was able to ask questions myself. Parking wasn't the best, but I needed to get work done. I'm not from the area, but I'd be back.
author: Clifford J.

description:
Decent coffee shop that would be generally good for studying or reading or hanging out...

Just not on hot days. They don't turn on the A/C, and it gets quite stuffy inside with not enough airflow.

I would definitely come back when the days are cooler (and bring a jacket).

Parking can be quite difficult.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
Free wifi, lots of seats, and decent neighborhood parking.

Love the amount of tables here and most importantly the amount of light this cafe gets. I really love a well lit cafe that sets a good environment for studying. They serve blue bottled coffee here, and I always shoot for the New Orleans iced coffee with sweetener and 2%.
author: Melanie T.

description:
I rendezvoused with friends there earlier today. Nice neighborhood cafe. I like the positive vibes from the place. 

But I hate the service! I ordered an egg salad sandwich with salad. Circa 15 minutes later, I asked about my order. Didn't get an apology. I'll just have to wait and see if my friends want to meet up there again.
author: Julio B.

description: Best coffee shop in the city! Variety of food and drinks, good music, parking is pretty easy around and the people that work there are so nice. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Gloria B.

description:
Here's the review I wish I could leave:

"A mostly comfortable cafe with limited space but big windows, plenty of outlets, reliable wifi, and good coffee. The prices aren't great but not terrible, and the music is usually pretty good. A little out of the way for people without a car but you do what you can with the cost of SF real estate. Overall a good deal. Four stars."

But if there was ever a time to start saying I just can't even, this is the exact moment where I just...can't...even.

Full disclosure, I came in with someone who already posted a review below. But I was there too, so I get a vote too, and in the end, the wages of sin is death.

Forget someone's latte? Fine. It happens. I've worked in food before--twice in the front of the house--and I get that things get busy and even when you're running as hard as you can sometimes not everyone will be completely satisfied. But when you mess up, the bare minimum that's required--and all that's required, if you're dealing with reasonable people--is to apologize and fix it as soon as you can.

Too much to expect in this case, apparently. Instead of finding out why a customer was waiting, the barista calling herself Jenn J. chose to chat with her fellow staff members and ignore my friend, paying her no mind. Then upon learning of the issue, the same Jenn J. accosted this same customer in an icy tone. The words may have literally been, OK, we'll start that for you right now, but it came out as a sneer, and in a way that conveyed the request for a drink already bought and paid for 20 minutes ago was a major imposition.

I don't know the reason for this hostility. I also don't know whether or not I was paying for someone else's supposed sins when Jenn J. later denied me entry to the restroom. To be sure, there was a piso mojado sign up, but that usually means watch out and be careful, not, the restroom is out of commission. Even if it was, the explanation was suspect because too long, and because of the gratuitous observation that I could use it in ten minutes, "if you're still here." Maybe she didn't mean anything by it. But I finally decided, I don't care. I only have to ask these questions in the first place because of the completely unnecessary hostility she visited on both of us earlier--hostility that neither of us came looking for, and that neither of us reciprocated.

And now I come to find that Jenn J. herself has responded to the first review describing this situation with an insulting and demeaning personal message. To the owners: Straight up, fire this person outright, or I will never patronize your business again. There are plenty of people--including both the customers whose morning she ruined that day--who take pride in their work and know to treat their customers with decency and respect. If that's not something you require of your staff, well, good luck with that.
author: James D.

description: I really like this place, mainly because of the quite ambiance I can actually get work done. I ordered an ice tea, it was fine but took awhile and the girl behind the register was apologetic about it. I felt bad because other customers were being rude about the wait time, they were short staffed and that's not the employees fault.
author: Alison J.

description:
The music, bright space and average coffee, the convenient location keeps me coming back (2 doors down from my yoga place). If you could care less about service while needing a place to do some studying/ working, this place is decent.

If you know your a type of person who cannot tolerate average food, delayed food service or unwelcoming cashiers, I would refrain from coming here.  I give it 3 stars for now.
author: Carleen C.

description:
My two stars is for the really bad service! I always go back to this place cause is only one block to where a live and the coffee is good, but I feel today was the last time. I am tired of the really bad attitude and uninterested way people work in this cafe. Its like they are making you a favor and don't realized we are paying a pretty expensive coffee. 
In my case, they forgot my orders several times, if I go between 5 to 6pm they always say its too late and kitchen is close, tho the cafe closes at 7pm. When that happens I always asked them just to warm my croissant with the microwave, but they don't like this either. 
I just can't understand why such a bad attitude towards their jobs. 
I do wanna say that it got a bit better since they change some of the employees, the new girls are somehow nicer than the guys before them.
author: Nicolas B.

description:
You're kidding me right

All I have to say is why would you give a customer burnt food !
author: Kelly C.

description: I love that they play good study music there so it makes it good to work at. They're coffee is good and also their food. Great staff too!
author: Jade J.

description:
Young guy serving needs to listen to what the customer orders! Got my order wrong and thus ended up over charging me. Heard the word chicken so took a stab at what I ordered even after I clarified twice. 

Asked for it to be 'eat in' still gave me food in a to-go bag.

Once I got the right sandwich it was pretty good. 

But they need to work on the guy taking the orders to get them right. He also told me to take someone else's order!!! Duh!!!
author: Leena S.

description:
These new Latin chicks except for the one with the glasses, are SUPER rude!!!! The skinny one with the red super acne looked me dead in my face and ignored me  when I asked her when will the owner return. When I asked her about it she rudely said she's working and gave me a crazy look. The other who barely heated my croissant tried to heat it up in the microwave. Before that I was waiting for a while to be helped. I asked may if I may give my order really nicely, she snapped back rudely saying they're busy. Smh. 

After today I'll never come back. This staff is the complete antithesis from the ones before, they were professional prior and super helpful. Too bad unprofessional employees can give your business a horrible look.
author: Zaariah B.

description:
Good coffee and Good food. 
But parking sucks (gotta find street parking)

What a smart location. You have your mix of customers (students, locals, gymmers and people like me who like going to different cafes). 

Mostly students and locals. Hence, it can get pretty packed. No worries, lots of tables and outlets scattered around. Tbh, I wasn't found of their table layouts. If you're like me and you like having square tables and space, they don't have much of that. It's perfectly fine if you grab one, but be willing to share!!! 

Cafe Mocha: 4/5. Loved the cute art. Definitely felt like it was a good combination of chocolate and lattee. The chocolate wasn't too sweet, but just subtle enough to enjoy. I wasn't a fan that my cup wasn't hot enough for me. I was hoping that for a rainy Saturday, a good hot cup would warm me up. 

Mushroom & Spinach Quiche: 3/5. I wasn't too found of it. I think I've had better quiches (including that one time I cooked it during school). 

Salmon Avocado Panini: 4/5 Delicious! Smoked salmon w/ capers, onion, avocado, cucumber and w/ some sort of spread. It was a very strong flavor due to the capers but that was perfect. As delicious as it was, I wish they would add a bit more contrast to the flavors. AKA, add more cucumbers, some tomatoes or lettuce. 

I think prices are reasonable. And it's always a great feeling supporting small businesses. 

Fifi would come back here again for studying purposes. She'd avoid going during midterm or final weeks though.
author: Fiona L.

description:
The fog lifter is very close to me, so yes its great for local people in the ocean avenue area. 
I've gone a couple times for a quick coffee, 
 but I have to tell you it's a great spot! The sun is always shining and the coffee is nice and the bagels are Yum E :)
author: Tere C.

description:
I hardly write reviews on places. But i have to, due to the rudeness of the Saturday morning staff. It was my 1st day trying this cafe. Not familiar at all with the way this place works. 
I work across the street so i wanted to have a little coffee and a snack before work. Jessica, the cashier seems to be having a bad morning. 
Not very helpful and very rude. I ordered a bagel and  she asked if i needed any spread. And i said yes, expecting her to give offers or options. Instead, she gave me a look. Then i asked for it on the side, since i didn't know how it was offered. 
It took a while for our order to be ready and i wanted to know how much longer, to what she replied  " there are 3 orders before yours" with an attitude. When my coffee  was ready.. it wasnt placed anywhere, instead left at the counter. I had to approached them to asked if it was my order. 
She was very rude responding to me.
Later, when a asked another worker what the girls name was. She said why?? With an attitude as well. She responded. Jessica.
I said because i will complain about her rudeness. Which she when over Jessica and told her what i had  said. 
Which to jessica responded  " i dont care"..
Thats not the way you treat your customers. Needless to say, i will never be back to this place.
And because of my job, im able to reach to a lot of people. I will  recommend NOT to visit this place.
Often i see small business complain about chain restaurants or coffee places take business from small shop. But if you treat your customers so poorly, we will prefer those big companies because we at least  we get an apology for the bad service.
author: Andrea G.

description: The coffee is great, the food is meh, the service couldn't be worse if they actually put effort into it. They'll take over 20 minutes to make a sandwich when there is no line and only two other people in the whole cafe. No apologies when things take longer, no smile when you enter or leave, and no thank you's ever! I come here after school a couple times a week when I'm in the mood for coffee better than Starbucks and service worse than a prison :)
author: Virginia J.

description: Went here a while ago with my sister. service was awful. I bought banana bread and the waiter asked me if I wanted it heated up. I asked for it to be heated up and she stuffed it in a MICROWAVE and completely forgot about it, going around helping others. While I was waiting for the bread she actually sat down at a table for 20 minutes and chatted with her friends. Hopefully she doesn't work there anymore. She was completely distracted by her friends and it ruined the whole mood. Very disappointing for SF.
author: Niki M.

description: I been coming here for almost two years and this new owner who just bought the spot had made it even better. I had a mocha today morning and it was great. I also got the pastrami sandwich pretty good!! Service was wonderful!!!
author: Anas S.

description: Always come here for there North Beach panini and also there house brew. Great spot to get some work done, read, or spark conversations. It's great for yoga lovers too because yoga flow is right next to it!
author: Anuja S.

description: Atmosphere is good, quality of coffee is also good. However, whenever you ask for a more specific type of beverage, they generally mess up. This has happened many times when I ordered an Americano.
author: Raymond F.

description:
I've been coming here for 3 years consistently, and only recently have I noticed a change in the customer service of this place. They don't care for your time and have incredibly poor service. It doesn't even feel like most of these baristas recognize you as a regular human being. Other reviews have confirmed the same experience.

Otherwise, the location is great and the coffee and food are still decent. Good place to study or work, as long as you distance yourself from the staff.
author: Amanda A.

description:
Real good coffee and latte art. Also, they serve Sightglass Coffee now. Definitely a nice spot to visit when you seek a cup of latte or mocha carefully handcrafted. It is always good to know that we have flexible coffee options here in the city.

Reasons for the 5 star rating:
- spacious path between chairs and tables (+1)
- drip coffee (+1)
- clean facility (+1)
- good service (+1)
- nice, friendly staff members (+1)

Free Wi-Fi available - props to this amenity!

It is near 24 Hour Fitness, great spot for the quick caffeine fix after the workout. Overall, positive first experience here!

FYI:
The KT Ingleside / Third Street has a stop on
- Ocean Ave and Dorado Terrace when coming from City College of San Francisco
- Ocean Ave and Jules Ave when coming from West Portal Ave
author: Bennett W.

description:
Awesome neighbourhood coffee shop!

FogLifter is run with a lot of love and care. I love coming here on a foggy morning and get a nice cup of warm coffee. You can come here when it's sunny as well, and take a seat outside or on the benches. 

Coffee - local and tasty. It's made to order and poured, so it will take a few minutes. Just a heads up, in case you're in a hurry, so you might want to avoid the crowds from yoga class ending.

Tea - they have about a dozen different types (Mighty Leaf style) 

Food - good selection for all your breakfast/lunch cravings (cookies, bagels, sandwiches, breakfast muffins, fresh fruit, OATMEAL mmmmm) 

Smoothies - my faaaaavourite! These are absolutely delicious =d

There are plenty of tables for people to work and study, just be respectful and don't spread out at a 4-person table if you're alone, especially during busy weekend times. Dog-friendly with their outdoor seating!
author: Jade T.

description: Amazing coffee!! The view from inside is so nice the owner is so chill he offered to show me the city too i recommend to go try his coffee
author: Swift L.

description:
WARNING: There is something disturbingly wrong with the manager here. She is hostile, bad-tempered and unpredictable. In short, we asked her not to mop near our table while we were eating, and she became verbally abusive, berated us and ordered us out of the cafe. This woman is a lawsuit waiting to happen.

We arrived 45 minutes before closing on Aug. 20 and asked a young employee at the counter if they were still serving, since the food was wrapped up, a section of the cafe was blocked off by chairs, and there was yellow tape across the bathroom entrance. She said they were open, so we ordered coffee and pastry and went to sit down at one of the available tables.

Minutes later, the manager (Erica, with tattoos, wearing a backwards baseball cap) pulled out an industrial bucket and wet mop reeking of cleaning fluid and started slapping the mop around. We asked her to please hold off while we were eating, that the fumes were overwhelming (this is a completely reasonable customer request - not to mention the fact that it is bad practice to clean while a restaruant is still open!). She became instantly combative, said this was how she did things and we could leave if we didn't like it. We were stunned.

When my husband commented on her rudeness and said he had just been in Japan where customers are treated like honored guests, she interrupted "Good for you!" He started to respond and she said, "Shut up, old man!" When he raised his voice in reply, she walked menacingly toward our table and threatened to call the police and have them throw us out of the café (absurd - for asking that she not mop near us?!). She also said she was banning us from ever coming back.

We are longtime patrons, working professionals, and have lived in this area for 20 years. We like to support local businesses. But we've never had such an outrageous thing happen, in this neighborhood or any other. 

This manager has no business interacting with the public. She poses a danger to others and is a liability for the business. Her hostile, angry outburst was a fireable offense. It's a shame the owner seems not to care (he ignored a letter we sent to him).

Ours is not an isolated incident - many other customers have been mistreated in recent months (see other posts). We want to warn others about the potential risk of interacting with Erica and encourage anyone who has had a negative experience to post on Yelp or report threats to city law enforcement.
author: Peppi M.

description: I used to like this place a lot more, but lately the service is now where as friendly as it used to be and I don't like that when you pay with a card, it immediately asks you to tip a minimum of 20%. Please just pay the employees more. I think part of the reason my service was lousy was that I put 18% in the jar for a bagel sandwich and did not tip the minimal 20% that they asked for on the ipad and they probably didn't see that, but I just refuse to pay 20% tip everytime I get a coffee or a bagel when there is no table service. That is just too much. Just give everyone a raise and stop asking for tips, please. Otherwise a pretty good spot!
author: Michelle S.

description:
REALLY rude service here. 

I ordered the eggplant panini. The menu (as you can see in my picture) lists pickles as one of the ingredients. My sandwich came without pickles and when I asked for some at the counter, the girl working there said "I don't think we have pickles" (even though they're listed on three of their sandwiches). Then a girl working in the back said pretty rudely, "Well, first of all, that's a typo on the menu". Then erase it? The menu is literally on a chalkboard, couldn't be an easier problem to solve. They seriously wouldn't give me some freaking pickles for a sandwich with pickles listed on the ingredients? What kind of sandwich place is this? 

Later my friend asked for some jam for his toast, which they wouldn't give to him either. I guess they don't have jam or pickles or customer service here.
author: Elen H.

description:
I'm a sucker for cozy cafes and this place is def a hit! Not only are their tables and chairs modern and appealing to the eyes, but their drink menu isn't too overwhelming as well. They have the standard coffee and teas all under 4 dollars and a wide selection of FOOD, other than your standard pastries you would find at any simple cafe. 

Though I came on a rainy day (this may have played a HUGE role in my opinion of the place because rain+cafe=major feels, ya feel) there was still a packed housed. Everyone was either working on their laptop or reading quietly to themselves. Even side conservations were kept to a minimal. In terms of atmosphere, this place gets bonus points! 

Though I hope this place does not get overly hyped/overly crowded, I did want to leave a positive review because of my awesome experience. So check this place out and enjoy (=
author: Mary L.

description:
This is a review for a visit from years ago when it visit opened.
I just remember loving the cream cheese variety the bagels, and thinking that the coffee was a religious experience. Will return again soon to see if this still rings true.
author: Shantall E.

description:
This place is great for a studying and getting work done day! Little bit small but feels open and kind of spacious.

This is my first time here but I'm very satisfied with staff who rang up for my Garden Bagel, they were very friendly ad nice. I also like the music that's played in here and it's not played too loud either.The Garden bagel consists on cream cheese, cucumbers, red onions, and tomatoes. Although it says on the menu that you get your choice of spread, I wasn't asked what kind of spread I would like. I don't know what other spreads they have and I wasn't informed so I guess I will ask next time.

There's a variety of seating here with good quality tables and sofas. There's also a very unique looking picnic table with nice benches. There are also long table that can hold abut 6 people, small 4 person tables, 4 couch like chairs and a bunch of small round tables. For your devices, there's about 10 outlets available as well.

Right by a residential area but parking is pretty packed even though there's a lot around. But I could spend all day in here so it's worth walking a couple blocks down for!

I'l be back again!! (:
author: Laura Y.

description:
Jenn J, the barista lady on duty that day, kindly sent me a private message. Word to word copied below:

I am certified and trained Barista. Call me what you want little liar. Now you can go ahead a write a false review but we both know your lying. Grow up.

Literal quote can give y'all a hint of the attitude you would get from this place.
author: Mi Y.

description:
3.5 stars, if we want to get specific. 

Pros: The coffee here is decent, there's lots of seating and parking is pretty easy around here. The convenience of it being near my house leads me to gravitate towards this place. The baristas are really sweet and overall there is a chill neighborhood vibe.

Cons? Food is a tad overpriced (expect to pay $10-11 for some pretty basic sandwiches, after tax). The bathroom is a freezing, dingy ass dungeon and it's prettyyyy gnarly in there. Think: wet floors, overflowing garbage can, dirty sink.. AND IT'S JUST SO COLD IN THERE. I really think they could work on keeping the bathroom cleaner.
author: M J.

description:
Service was unacceptable. Food was okay-nothing special-but no mistakes.

After eating we were asked to move, which was fine. We moved the table out of its original spot anyways, so as two servers we understood. 

We decided to leave after moving the table back and looked around the door for a place to bring our plates. We both didn't see anywhere so we stacked our plates and headed out. Three steps out the door and a yell comes from behind the counter, "WILL YOU BUSS YOUR TABLE!" 

I guess we missed the little hole in the area that looked like it was just for sugar and utensils. Regardless, this was unacceptable.

If you are looking for nice people with better food (because why wouldn't you) I recommend going two blocks over to Java on Ocean.
author: Luke R.

description:
Uhm yeah wow why did I give this place only 4 stars before? I'm hooked.

This place is walking distance from CCSF, but if you really gotta take the K or drive, then by all means go for it. But the walk there is actually really nice, especially in the morning when you gotta wake up, like me. It's a small quaint little cafe near 24 hour fitness. Inside you'll find small tables, two sets of couches by the window, and a long table for people to share. There's a very homely atmosphere here, great for catching up with a pal or to study up and read.

The menu is fairly vast, serving coffee and tea, smoothies, salads and sandwiches, and pastries. The workers are very attentitive. They work fast and help you through the menu if you ask them. 

This place serves some legit delicious coffee. I love coffee and have tried some places that serve the legit kind of coffee (not the kind at Starbucks, just saying) and this place has got it down. I love Chasing Lions at CCSF, but sometimes I gotta get around to other places. They serve drip coffee here and you can actually see them do it right by the register. Neato!

I've had the following:
- Caffe Mocha: this can be served in a cup if you're planning on staying, or in a paper cup to-go. Their mocha is very strong, the chocolate is rather prominent if anything. It's a warm and silky drink that isnt too hot, but it's warm enough to warm your insides on a cold day. If you have a sweet tooth and would prefer not to deal with the strong taste of coffee, this is your best bet.

- Macchiato: this is preferably served if you are planning to stay in the cafe. Their traditional macchiato is served in a tiny glass cup, somewhat like a shot glass lol. This drink is pretty strong, they dont use too much cream and it goes straight down with a bitter cocoa taste. A preferable drink for those who can handle a few caffeine jitters. You can also take it to-go, but i believe thats a different macchiato.

- Hot chocolate: what i really like about this place, is that they have drinks for kiddos too. Their hot chocolate is really smooth and has a hint of cream in it. Naturally the chocolate is dominant in taste, but it goes down nicely.

LATTE ART. They do that here. It's pretty cool, if you show them a picture they may actually try to make it. But I am satisfied with the classic leaf latte art :). They accept cash and card whooop! 

I think i might frequent this place more. When i try their other drinks i will update this review heh.
author: Jerianne G.

description: So I decided to stop here for a cup of tea since it was quite cold out. I decided on a vanilla bean tea which was very good. The atmosphere here is more of a casual environment. There are quite a few students here since a college is very near by. Overall a great experience and great prices I will definelty be back.
author: Asseret B.

description: Consistently poor service. Obviously being courteous and welcoming to customers is not a priority. Wish it was because everything else at this place is great.
author: Edward H.

description:
BEWARE: THIEVES STEAL LAPTOPS HERE!! Not the business' fault as they do have HD cameras installed but I've been here on two separate occasions and both times saw someone come in and steal someone's computer from right in front of them! Very scary and sad :(

Anyways...onto a more positive topic, I love the food here! Their sandwiches are deliciousssss and incredibly generous portions/pricing. Faves are the North Beach (Portobello Mushroom, Goat cheese, sun-dried tomatos, onions, spinach) and the Vegan Falafel with Hummus!

Their coffee is super strong (a bit too bitter for me) but I do love the spacious workspace here and the wifi and ample outlets.
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Ordered a panini and coffee.  The coffee was great.

The panini came with the following ingredients noted on the menu: salami, provolone, tomato, spinach, and red onion.  I ordered it without cheese.  However, they also put mustard which I absolutely hate.  Other items on the menu note that they have mustard or other sauces, but this panini did not.

When I asked them to remake it they refused, and the owner (? person in charge) got very upset and inferred that I 'should have known', which was extremely rude.  Eventually was able to get them to refund me but did not provide any type of receipt.  Here's hoping I don't have to contest the charge.

2/5: +1 star for the friendliness of the other workers, +1 for the coffee, -2 for service, and -1 for inaccurate menu. Won't be coming back unfortunately.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Good spot n good Americano but after not coming back for so long, I gave it another shot to see if things have changed. Not really, same reason why I stopped coming-the music. The rap and hip hop playlist is filled with inappropriate songs including swearing. I tried to drown it out w headphones but music is a bit loud. Difficult to work so I'm going to where old ppl go-a quiet cafe with quiet music.
author: Mark H.

description:
I really like this place. This cafe has a lot of natural sunlight. It's not hard to find parking. Always have good service. It has a decent crowd of customers. A lot of people study or hang out there. I personally don't drink coffee, but they have a good selection for tea.  Decent cafe food was well. 

This is a good place for people who want to read and relax.
author: Rachael C.

description:
My boyfriend and I usually come here on mornings about once every other week. Recently we came by here one morning to get some coffee and egg & cheese croissants (the only things we ever order here). After ordering, we waited about 20 minutes with no egg & cheese croissant called up. We have ordered them many times before and we know that it does not take that long to make, even on a busy morning. He went up to remind the folks behind the register that we ordered food, after which they assured us that they'd be coming up soon. We waited about 10-15 minutes longer to no avail. In the meantime, we observed other customers' drinks and food getting served (including sandwiches and a *plain* croissant). I hate to bring the race angle into it, but it should be said that my boyfriend was the only black guy in the cafe and we were the only mixed race couple. I'm willing to give the employees the benefit of the doubt, but it's hard not to feel singled out when everyone else seems to be quickly served except us.

Anyway, we ended up just getting a refund with no explanation as to what had occurred. I don't know if new management is to blame, but this just really put a dent in our morning. I used to love this cafe and I didn't want to give a negative review. I also work in customer service, so I sympathize with how tough it could get sometimes. Yet I also just wanted to somehow get my voice out to let the establishment know that these basic requirements were not met, our experience was unsatisfactory, and our morning routine was completely thrown off. We will not be returning.
author: Lyzette G.

description:
My first experience at fog lifter's was when I got a hot chocolate. It tasted like dish water with a bit of cocoa mixed in. Couldn't finish it. 1/5

I decided to try it again and got another hot chocolate with extra chocolate. This was 3297598% better. It was super yummy and they added whipped cream on top (which they did not do the first time). I guess the quality of the drinks depends on who makes it. 

Also got a lox bagel and they ran out of bagels so they used a croissant instead....

Wifi is a-okay as well. It disconnected a couple times but other than that, it's fine.

Tip: Do not eat outside food in there. I learned the hard way. :P

ALSO, REMEMBER TO CALL AND ASK WHAT TIMES THEY ARE OPEN ON HOLIDAYS BECAUSE THEY DO NOT UPDATE THEIR YELP VERY OFTEN!
author: Anna H.

description:
Good coffee and good cookie, but the customer service was lacking. Way too pushy to get us out the door after we paid left tip and there was still 30 minutes left.. loud and unnecessary reminder that 15 minutes remaining and restroom was "closed."  Not cool, bro, I had to pee (coffee). 

Poor customer service.
author: Jingo Django J.

description:
It's a rare occasion to find a spacious coffee shop in San Francisco. It's even rarer to find it not completely full! The bf and I stopped by here today because we were looking for free wifi (password: garlic14) and the quaint "Fog Liter" cafe came up in our search results -high ratings, Blue Bottle drip coffee, outlets and tables? I'm sold! 

It's 2 in the afternoon on a beautifully lit, overcast Saturday and this place isn't overpacked. Big tables - great for groups of 6, solo comfy sofa chairs, and tiny circle tables for two; choose whatever suits you best! There are still vacant chairs and a regular flow of customers coming in and going out. People are reading the newspaper, books, on their laptops and iPads (me on my phone typing this review out) while sippin on delicious blue bottle caffe. They have some chill music with good beats playing. I feel very relaxed - I'd love to study here if I was a student. 

PROS
-As mentioned before, free wifi! 
-Comfy sofa chairs 
-Friendly baristas
-Restroom included - if it's locked then that means someone is inside
-Tons of outlets so bring your chargers!
-They serve good here too! Sandwiches, soups, bagels... Yeah the dude next to me just ordered a Lox bagel and said "you guys are too good to me" upon picking it up. Pretty cute if you ask me. 

If I'm back in this part of town looking for a place to chill, I'm stopping by here :)
author: Grace J.

description:
Called several times to place in an order but no one picked up. There were 3 people working when I got there and they weren't busy. I knew my panini would take a while and sure enough, I sat there for a while waiting for it. Ugh 

Ordered the salmon panini and it was super salty. It has capers which is the cause of the high salt content but instead of just a few, if basically covered the bread and was spilling out. Portion is filling.

Lots of pastries, cookies and drink on the menu. They also have salads.
author: Julie L.

description:
I ordered 7 bagels for take out one day for a morning meeting. I placed the order over the phone and surprising in ten minutes I got a call letting me know my bagels were ready. Not sure if they do this on a regular basis, but I really appreciated the call ! *Thumps up ! 

Oh ! & the bagels were also yummy ! I ordered jalapeño with plain cream cheese and also blueberry with plain cream cheese :D
author: Samantha Y.

description:
Unpretentious little cafe where one is not required to genuflect at the feet of the Himalayan coffee gods. I prefer my iced coffee with chicory not unlike an Oxford comma: to wit, a way to make things better that is not extrajudicially enforced.

Try the quiche. They both microwave it but then use a hovering panini press to crisp the filigreed edges. Delectable.
author: Peter W.

description:
Fog Litter is a nice place to chill on Ocean Ave. A community table, a couple of smaller ones, and sofas. Overall a very laid back feel, with friendly baristas.

I've a half an hour to kill and enjoyed my Blue Bottle based AMERICANO ($3) as well as a fresh donut.

This place is frequented by locals and the student folks at CCSF. Not much parking available but worth the walk if you're stranded in the area.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
A nice quaint small business cafe shop on Ocean Ave. 

I went in on a Saturday morning and it was packed! Probably because of college kids are preparing for their finals and yoga students from the studio down the block called Yoga Flow just finished their morning ritual. I got their organic chai latte - it's spicy and yummy goodness!

The service is great, w/ like 4-5 girls handling the register, making the food, and mixing the drinks. Parking is hard to find but I was lucky enough to park on that 10-minute only parking!
author: Jan P.

description: It's a great atmosphere for studying, good music. Not super crowded and lots of tables to sit at. Good wifi, very easy to study. Lots of tables. They have a good menu and they were very friendly/good customer service.
author: Clara D.

description:
On my latest trip to Fog Lifter, I sat in the middle community table. This table is perfectly located to catch a really severe cross breeze that makes me feel like it's a Chicago winter (COLD!). I felt compelled to downgrade my review after my latest experience. 

I left my parka at home today so I tried closing the door. The chef came over and told me to leave the door open for ventilation! I get that it can get stuffy but this lead me to believe that the kitchen doesn't have an adequate ventilation system. This made me think of one word... UPGRADE.

UPGRADE THE VENTILATION SYSTEM! On my last visit visit, I overheard the owner saying he clears like thousands a day on food alone.. So, I know it's not for a lack of revenue. 

The food is decent and the coffee is decent but at least Greenhouse doesn't make me feel like I'm going to catch hypothermia.

For the record, the ends of the room might not be as windy. I just can't believe how a successful coffee shop be inadequately retrofitted. I'll be back.. but with my winter coat.
author: Chris W.

description:
The cold brewed coffee is so delicious and probably my favorite drink here. It's brewed in some 24-hour long process, giving it a very bold and non-bitter (in my opinion) taste. However, there is a limited supply of cold brew coffee available each day, so come early and snag a cup! 

It is also worth mentioning that they use high-quality coffee beans for all their drinks, including Blue Bottle and Sightglass (I think they rotate) :) 

Drinks aside, this is an awesome place to camp out with your laptop! Great natural lighting, lots of tables, abundant outlets, fast wifi, never too crowded, good choice of music, enough (free) street parking 1-2 blocks away. Definitely one of my go-to cafes to work in the immediate area.
author: Samantha C.

description:
This cafe lifts the fog as well as my spirits!

This is a nice spot to get work done with their free wifi, ample seating and tables, caffeine, and good food.

Their sandwiches are all deliciously made with quality ingredients. My favorite is the smoke turkey provolone with hickory-smoked turkey breast, provolone, organic spinach, tomato, and a pesto aioli. Their bread choices include wheat and dutch crunch. I enjoy how filling and tasty yet healthy their sandwiches are.

Their chai latte is also good. Milk options include whole, nonfat, almond, and soy. Thumbs up for latte art, too!

I also got their blueberry monster smoothie once. The texture was a bit chalky to me, and I'm not too keen on getting it again.

I'll definitely be back for their sandwiches and wifi!
author: Tanya A.

description: I go here only when I have to. The menu is nice the sandwiches are ok. But the pricing of the drinks are a bit high. I mean, a good latte is great but let's be reasonable as well. The seating is decent. I especially like the big cushioned seats. Nice place to go to chill and read. It gets crowded quickly as well. My recommendation is to go grab a cup sit outside and relax.
author: Robert F.

description:
Updated. It's been a year since I've been here. Unfortunately the new staff are very rude, unfriendly and not kind. 

Sad, but I won't be be coming back here again.
author: Amira G.

description:
I'll be honest, I had a hard time figuring out all the hype. Was the coffee good? Yes. We also had smoothies, which were definitely tasty.

The tough part is that I felt like I waited too long for my coffee. I totally dig and understand the whole trendy "drip-style" coffee, but the allure wore off after waiting in line for so long. If I had to guess, I would say that I waited for 10 minutes, before getting to the counter. At the counter, I waited another 3 minutes to be acknowledged. After that initial wait, the employees were friendly and kind.

I agree with the other reviews... If you're looking for a place to read or study, look no further. Order your coffee and expect a wait time longer than normal.

If you're looking for a quick, Starbucks type of experience, this is not the place for you.

I'll be back, but I'll be sure to choose a time when I'm not in a rush!
author: Brian F.

description:
I was in the area to pick up a package and wanted to check out local cafes that were laptop and WiFi friendly.  Fog Lifter is right across the street from the gym and there's plenty of neighborhood parking, so I figured it would be a solid choice to camp at for a while.

Their menu looked pretty good and I needed lunch so I opted for a sandwich.  I ordered a turkey and provolone sandwich, which took forever to deliver.  There was also no provolone in it, but did come with a lash hair.  I was so disappointed by the experience that I probably will never order another sandwich here again, instead opting for one of their prepackaged items like drinks.  I would have taken it back except I really didn't get the sense that the girl behind the counter cared so I just dealt with it.  In retrospect I should have sent it back.

Service was really unfriendly and I was definitely not getting a good vibe from the grungy cashier girl.  The WiFi is decent though and there's plenty of places to sit, which make it an appealing place for students to study.  I'll try other cafes before finding my way back here next time.

Food: 4/10

Service: 4/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description: Nice little shop, but apparently they don't carry change. Didn't even get to order anything.
author: Jacob M.

description:
Fog Lifter Cafe is the perfect place to spend time and get work done on a sunny day! Right off the K Line in Ingleside, the Fog Lifter cafe is extremely accessible, yet not overly crowded.

When looking for a place to be productive, I have three criteria: space, food, and connectivity. The Fog Lifter Cafe meets all three! The food is pretty on point. The coffee options are what you'd expect from an establishment in San Francisco (pour over etc) and they have great bagel sandwiches for lunch. Additionally, there is free wifi, enough outlets, and plenty of tables to make oneself comfortable. 

For the floating student or employee, I definitely recommend adding Fog Lifter Cafe to your list of cafes!
author: Sophia A.

description:
Great cafe with quality food and drink. You definitely get what you pay for at the Fog-Lifter. 

Ambience = cozy and warm, interesting locally built tables and benches
Waitstaff = friendly and efficient
Location = great, right off the K-Ingleside, limited car parking, but I've always found free spots.
Wifi = strong and clear

Could you ask for more from a coffee shop?
author: B. A.

description: Nice and cozy cafe on Ocean Ave.  Stopped by on a chilly afternoon with the other half.  Neither of us are coffee drinkers, so we both opted for tea.  They serve Mighty Tea Leaf.  I got the herbal ginger and he got the green tea.  $2.50/cup.  Good amount of seating, huge windows for lots of natural light and nice tunes.  Parking can be hit or miss but we ended up in the residential area.  Location is across the street from the 24 Hour Fitness and Target.
author: Liv A.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been here more than a few times. I've seen a lot of reviews that have complained about the people working there but I've never experienced any attitude or bad service. Their coffee is good and they don't mind customers hanging out for a while using their free WiFi.
author: Bumble B.

description:
"All Day Breakfast" and great service all day. Coffee made by the cup. WiFi and some places to plug-in for power. Good overhead lighting and indirect light through big, unobstructed Windows. Friendly locals frequent this cafe. Indoor seating for over 50, and a few tables might be outside at the sidewalk.
LOCATION: Free street parking everywhere and metered spaces on Ocean Avenue.
SERVICE: They aim to satisfy and I see a lot if smiling going on. 
SANITATION: Very clean. The bathroom key thing is necessary. Simply return it using a paper towel to keep your hands clean. 
DISABILITIES: I have never seen any obstructions on the sidewalk. The entrance has double doors. There are no steps in the customer access areas. 
MENU: Posted on the wall.
Beverages: Hot from the Barista and cold from the chill box. Araciba coffees.
DECORATIONS: Tasteful and complete. Nothing distracting and there is some art to admire.
author: The Adv G.

description:
For the Sunday afternoon counter help, the finer points of making an iced mocha are evidently much less compelling than the details of their personal lives. This I judge by the volume and length of their commentary on same, and the ridiculous near-10 min. it took them to make a simple drink. 
  "Be the star of your own life," said a wise man once, implying that to do so was necessary and also sufficient. These two, instead of treating customers like interlopers in their conjoined one-woman shows, ought to take that message to heart.

What emerged from this loud and long production was a weak concoction, light on flavor. Its price wasn't posted on the menu board, but was ring up at a rich $4.50
author: John H.

description:
Great coffee and I also got the smoke turkey provolone which was delish!!!

Very nice place to study and chill.

Staff was friendly and service was fast.
parking sucked, but hey, its on the street.
Price was good and so was the food.
author: Roger A.

description:
I have been coming to Fog Lifter for several months now. When I left the neighborhood, my biggest loss was being so close to this great place. Bummer!

I still come back at least a couple of times a month, from North Beach and plenty of nice coffee options. So you know my 5 stars matter. :)

The Fog Lifter crew always remembers me and Brillo (Service Dog/ person helper professional)! Every employee strikes me as friendly and invested. The 2 kind-hearted and efficient gals who ask about Brillo, you always make my day. And the chef makes great grub, with such a warm attitude. *blush*

Yes, the coffee's good! Sight Glass brand, hook me up! I like their white chocolate mocha, vanilla iced coffee, or a simple coffee straight-up (I add the extras). Chai lattes are yum: spicy goodness.

Do order the tasty yet simple grilled cheese (made by the awesome chef)! The soup option changes, I have enjoyed it every time. I think you can try a small sample cup, but yeah you want it. The sandwiches are great (and big). Cookies and such are available, too.

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed. Always clean. Lots of laptops and books, but friendly strangers readily share tables. It's got a communal feel.

Indoor/ outdoor seating options. Music usually playing, various genres.
author: Mary S.

description: I live around the corner from this coffee shop.  I've, frequented it several times.  The food is pretty tasty, the  However, the coffee is really acidic and way to strong considering I like strong coffee.  I've actually vomited twice after drinking their coffee believe it or not.  And if I didn't throw up I felt very nauseous. I have a strong stomach too.  If your there for food I'd say go but don't risk the coffee.
author: Sarah D.

description: I came to study at this Cafe on 8/21/2016, around 2PM. I needed to use the restroom, so I ask the guy at the counter if I can get the key to use the restroom. He told me, I couldn't use the restroom cause I haven't bought anything. I told him I would be buying something later as I would be there for a couple of hours studying. He said I couldn't use the restroom which I thought was crazy, but it's their rules. I sit down to study and he came over and told me I had to leave cause I haven't bought anything. I wasn't bothering anyone in the Cafe, which wasn't even half full, with plenty of seats for people to sit. I got up and left and went to another Cafe!
author: James H.

description:
I might increase my review later, as I'd like to work out of here more often. Parking is plentiful (around the corner and down the block is all-day parking). 

The coffee is decent, but when you already start with blue bottle coffee its hard to mess it up. Blue Bottle coffee without the crazy lines that happen downtown! That plus a relatively comfortable place to work and strong WiFi makes me inclined to come here more often.

I'm just a little iffy based on staff here. Staff in general are cool. They run your orders pretty quickly, and from my best guess are probably students. They're just not the most customer-service oriented or...for lack of better words, professional. 

When I got my coffee, I was relatively friendly and the staff was...not. But I don't need bubbles and smiles all the time. It just felt a little curt/rude when I don't believe I did anything wrong. Hell, for a $3.50 coffee, I tipped $1. They were also complaining about what I can only assume was a yelp review, as the female behind the counter mentioned "flagging it" several times, as evidently the review was about her. But...maybe there's a reason this girl was mentioned in a previous review. 

I'd normally bump this place to a 4 star, because its a place I WOULD like to return to (though...if I come back and get mean service, I'd hazard a guess that they found out who I am and is not pleased). I'm bumping down because...of unprofessional demeanor. 

It looked like someone had left a jacket, as this female staff skipped over to a table and loudly exclaimed "someone left their jacket!" Then. She promptly puts on the jacket. And sniffs it. 

Umm. No. I'm sorry. If someone left an item, you should only take it to the back or a safe place and hold it in hopes the person comes back. Feel free to wear and sniff if the jacket's been there for a month or even a WEEK and no one's returned to claim it. But. To wear someone's jacket who left it there for maybe an hour? No.
author: Lily W.

description:
Me and my husband have been going to this place over 3 years. I can't believe what just happened today with the girl behind the counter kick us out in front of everyone and yelled at us because of our service Dog. 
My husband it is a Veteran and we have the dog certified by the VA which allow us to take the dog even in airplanes. This person that made us the sandwiches calls herself "Manager" I am completely discussed in state this here folks, but I have to take out of my frustration somewhere and thanks to Yelp that everyone can see this including the owner- having someone like that in your business watch out before you go broke and lose your customers. 
She even state don't come back here anymore (seriously) because of my service dog? She looked back at us psychotic and tried to get physically aggressive over us and the dog. I almost called the cops on her and the other girl behind the counter was encouraging her to fight. 
I hope the owner of the shop replies this to me or I will take legal action based on this unacceptable behavior from someone like this. She completely disrespect a United States Veteran with disability. I don't know who trained her as a "Manager" and said she knows the law and bla bla bla. NO YOU don't know the law and you don't know how to treat people. The time we were there was exactly 12:35 of August 5th 2016. I would love an explanation from the owners on this one feel free to contact me. I hope the owners will do something about the rude staff they have on board before someone close your business 
          
  2011 0334309-00 FOG LIFTER CAFE, THE 03/21/2011 21-MAR-11  
    1901 OCEAN AVENUE      
    SAN FRANCISCO, CA 94112      
    ------------------------------------------------------      
  Owner SWIRKY JAWAD H   21-MAR-11  
    SWIRKY MARIA   21-MAR-11
author: Gilmar G.

description:
The coffee is ok. My cup was cold, which is surprising for manual drip. The service, however, was the worst experience I have had in a long time.

I went in at about 7:30 am on 8/5/16. First off the woman who made my bagel threw it on the counter for me to pick up. Then she and her coworker thought it was hilarious to loudly start laughing at a homeless man that was standing on the corner (I have been in this neighborhood for six years. That guy is very sweet and is very mentally ill). They were making really gross, demeaning comments, pointing loudly, and shouting stuff like "stay off drugs!" I turned around and started to defend the man, and then the main barista or cashier (African American gal wearing a ridiculous shirt that said something amongst the lines of -I kid you not-"thanks for giving me your little petty opinion") said "why are you giving us your opinion?"  I dropped it then and walked out. I don't understand how such ignorant, disgusting people are allowed to work in this place. It's okay to have different opinions about homelessness and the like but making fun of mentally ill people is never ok. 

After reading some other reviews, including a woman who was harshly kicked out for having a service animal, I will never return to such a pathetic establishment that has no interest in being a good part of our growing community and is more devoted to discriminating against folks and serving subpar food.
author: Ana C.

description:
Decent food.  Nice people at the counter.  Clean.  Coffee drinks are pretty good.  Warm and pleasant ambiance.  

One star off for the Tip Jar, which bears a sign urging us to tip, and then bullying us: "Do Not Be Rude."  I am a generous tipper and these people earn their tips.  But I simply cannot tip when being admonished in advance.  Doesn't work for me.
author: Ernest F.

description:
Fog Lifter is one of my favorite cafes to study at in the area. They serve Blue Bottle Coffee, have delicious lattes and mochas, and offer an extensive menu of salads, sandwiches, and pastries. 

There are plenty of seats, with tables for two, comfy couches by the window, or a long table that's perfect for groups or sharing with fellow cafe-goers. 

The cafe boasts a nice clean and bright space with few distractions inside and the corner location and large windows allow for abundant people watching and lots of natural light. Friendly employees and free wi-fi are the icing on the cake. A great neighborhood cafe and a highlight of Ocean Avenue!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
Horrible service.

I used to be a loyal customer - I live very and close and it was my go-to spot. Now I avoid this cafe at all costs due to the very rude staff. The girls who work there greet you with extremely bad attitudes and are not friendly whatsoever (you'd think they'd understand what customer service means). 

Today I witnessed the "chef" get into a verbal altercation with a customer b/c this customer wanted change and they wouldn't break his $5 bill for him. 

With my own personal experience, every time I ask the cashier a question she responds with very rude and demeaning remarks. I understand the owner is probably thankful for his new "manager" so he doesn't have to be around as often, but they are driving customers away! And it looks like I'm not the only person who feels this way.

Also, I made a yelp account today just so I could post this review. I've never felt so offended.
author: Janelle E.

description:
Great coffee, nice people, cool decoration, good seating, fast WiFi. 
They have very high quality coffee and they brew very well. Never tried the food though.
author: Michelle J.

description: Great environment for getting work done. Great music and helpful staff. Pro tip: they will make any sandwich into a wrap.
author: Steve M.

description: Spacious cafe with many open tables. Not too loud or quiet. Suitable environment for studying & Free wifi!
author: Sophia L.

description: Don't know what they're doing half the time. Long waits for an order they are going to mess up anyway. I'm not writing this because of one bad experience. Maybe if I order slower they will get it right. After waiting so long for my screwed up orders the last thing I'd want to do is wait even longer for them to fix it(probably would screw that up too). How hard is it? This place is not even that busy when they mess up orders and it's 9/10 times they mess mine up. So I'm done here for now.
author: Lev D.

description: Horrible service. Ordered panini took almost 25 min for them to inform us they were out of roast beef. I then ordered a quice...took over 20 min to get that and when I did it was cold! SERIOUSLY?  NEVER AGAIN
author: Kathy B.

description: Vegan falafel was awful for 8.15 not enough filling.. they are only good for coffee. Service was good, just very disappointed in the food. It was terrible, i will never eat here again..
author: Shaun L.

description:
I have been here several times, but seriously doubt I will be back after the way I was treated by the young lady with the just below shoulder length dirty blonde hair working on Dec 29th just after 1pm.
Dear owner- if you read this, you might want to talk to her. If she is treating other people as rudely as me, she is costing you business.
author: Jon M.

description: They are super coffee snobs. Extremely Rude. Made me feel extremely bad. Straight up just said no to what I wanted . I'm not homeless.  I was clothed. There was no reason why I couldn't get my order to go even if it's served cafe only. First of all dumb rule. Second, have a better attitude when trying to educate me... Who are they to tell me how I should drink my drink?!!!! I couldn't believe the customer service. It's just freakin coffee people!!!! Stupid hipsters behind the counter had terrible attitudes. Horrible. I'll never go there again. As I was leaving there was another lady who was walking out saying "you know?! I come here all the time! You can't treat me like that!" Huh...
author: Jennifer C.

description: Very great cafe! Great service and the food is always great. The coffee is pretty amazing as well. Atmosphere is also very comfortable and relaxing
author: Rudy C.

description:
Fog Lifter Cafe does not literally lift the dreaded fog on Ocean Avenue, but they do lift your spirits in the midst of a busy week!

Serving Blue Bottle Coffee from early bird morning to evening dusk, Fog Lifter provides the much needed boost to any travelers in the fog. Weary wanderers can also find a hot sandwich here if the weather gets too cold outside.

My favorite thing from this cafe is actually their coffee cup caps. It's smooth and steady to the lips, optimally designed to enhance your coffee drinking experience. There are ample space in the cafe for dwellers to study, hang out, or simple to wait for the fog to lift. Pretty cool place to say the least. 

But when CCSF loses it's accreditation, many surrounding businesses like Fog Lifter may be put to sleep from the reduced traffic. Let's hope this little cafe has enough caffeine up it's brewers to stay awake through the tough times.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Came by July 4th morning, and surprise, they were open!

I was visiting home for the weekend (living/working in LA now) and was craving some delicious coffee before starting the day. After searching through yelp and with the recommendation of a friend, we were advised to try Fog Lifter Cafe since they serve Blue Bottle Coffee. 

I ended up ordering a almond milk latte. The drink was perfection Perfect aroma, nice roast, the right amount of foam, none of that burnt taste. 

I was really happy with my choice and my friend got a lox bagel that was really generous on the salmon.

If i'm ever back in Sf visiting my neighborhood, i'll definitely stop by. It seems like a nice place to study.
author: Diane T.

description:
Nice cafe with wood floors and plenty of wooden tables & chairs. Free WiFi and nice staff who are willing and able to customize your food or drinks however you may want it.

However, the 3 star review is primarily for what I ordered (I'm sure other things may be great from what I've seen of other reviews). The chai latte was only a bit warm, not hot, kinda diluted tasting, and served with too much foam. The apricot bar was alright, although it was tougher to chew than I was expecting.

Otherwise, it's a great space to study or meet up with a friend.
author: Andrew T.

description: Fog lifter is my go-to when I need to get some work done in an active environment. I enjoy their smoothies and pour over coffees. They are always featuring a pretty decent blend. I sometimes stop in after a workout and pick up a sandwich as well. Their omelette bagel is delicious, as well as the eggplant panini! You can add avocados/tomatoes for an added bonus. There is plenty of seating, both indoors and out. I just wish they had better connectivity to their wifi! :(
author: Sarin P.

description: I love this neighborhood coffee shop.  The food is great, the pastries amazing, the breakfast sandwiches/bagels on point.  The staff is awesome.  The coffee is on point. It's really a perfect combination of things that make this my go-to place for coffee/breakfast.  I come here then take the muni across the street to work, making the start to my day as pleasant as can be :).
author: Ghizal A.

description:
Nice little cafe if you need to get some work done and don't want to go to an overcrowded Starbucks. It's spacious and plenty of tables to choose from. 

The coffee is okay. They stopped serving Blue Bottle Coffee though. The food is good and filling if you need a bite. There's a variety of sandwiches to choose from. My boyfriend always gets their fruit smoothies, which are good. 

Parking might be tricky, as it is on a busy street like Ocean. But, there's always residential parking that lasts 2 hours, I believe. So if you don't mind the walk, park there for free!
author: Liezel D.

description:
For anyone looking for a study/reading spot that's easily accessible by public transportation and not too far from both City College and SF State, Fog Lifter is a great option. The cafe has a variety of caffeinated beverages for those of you looking for an energy boost (they've switched from serving Blue Bottle coffee to Sightglass in recent months - freshly brewed) in addition to a great selection of sandwiches, salads, breakfast items, and pastries. 

Every time I come here there's ample seating (both inside and outside especially with a relatively new parklet right out front) for anyone looking to camp out and beastmode for a few hours before an exam. The staff is friendly and they're always got an incredibly diverse music playlist going, which is pretty fascinating (today included Ben Howard, Avril Lavigne, and a Mongolian throat-singing ballad just to name a few)! 

All in all, great natural light, prime location, reasonably priced food and beverages (with an impressive selection both hot and cold), and free wifi. Fog Lifter is a great addition to the Ocean Avenue neighborhood and hopefully won't be leaving anytime soon!
author: Cheston W.

description:
Good:
Slow Drip Coffee is rather delicious
Bruce Cost Ginger Ale (Jasmine flavor? Didn't taste any jasmine though)
Music (Italian circus-like. Gotta learn the name for it. Think Cirque du Soliel)

Not so much:
Oat bar (pretty dry)
Slow wi-fi (password: garlic14)
author: Alice R.

description: Great place to work on your papers, school work or just write.  Good coffee.  Good number of tables and chairs.  But they need more outlets.
author: Nicole V.

description: I come here every weekend with my bf. There's plenty of tables and chairs and outlets to charge your phone/laptop. We LOVE the almond milk chai tea latte, lox bagel, pastrami panini, and the salmon avocado panini. Besides the great food and drinks the staff is always really friendly which is a huge plus. :]
author: MissChelle C.

description:
I really like this place - this was not my first experience and definitely not last. 
I think the biggest attraction for me was ambience of the place, it's welcoming and friendly, works equally as a refuge on a cold and rainy day and a nice open space on sunny warm day with tables outside to enjoy the Sun. You can find all different kinds of people there - students with their laptops and books, girlfriend meeting up for coffee, a family having breakfast (at least 3 generations from what I could tell), a passer-by coming in for a cup of a delicious Blue Bottle coffee... and me - just stopping by to get some good coffee and breakfast/ snack/ light dinner. 
Tried so far - Coffee! yes, Coffee! pastries are OK, but focus on their quiches and sandwiches.  The nice "feature" about this place - they listen, they customize, they smile and they make it happen! not on the menu - not a problem as long as they have ingredients to make it (or at least my experience has been like that).
author: Marianna K.

description: The fog lifter is one of my favorite places to get coffee or breakfast and study. The quality of food and drinks is awesome and the staff is always nice and friendly. They also have a really great chai that isn't too sweet or spicy.
author: Andrea M.

description:
Just a little bummed that they are not serving blue bottle coffee anymore but the sight glass that they are now serving ain't bad either! 

Anyhow,  I just love love love the vibe of this place ;)
author: Catrina L.

description:
I was only there to catch up with a friend. He got a drip brew and I got a chai latte with soy milk. It was nice and creamy and the right amount of sweet. 

It's a quaint cafe, definitely a study spot type of place. Most of the people who were there seemed like they were there for a quiet work space. Staff was nice. My friend tells me it varies. They seemed to have a good selection of other teas and vegan snacks. 

I wouldn't mind going back.
author: Sofia R.

description: I love this spot. They have outdoor seating which is nice on a sunny day, and it's convenient for me because I live close and I love coming here to get some studying done or to grab a quick bite and some coffee. The coffee is really good and their sandwiches are delicious as well. The grilled chicken panini, turkey sandwich and Caesar chicken is delicious!
author: Tanya M.

description:
In my opinion, this is one of the best coffee shops in the neighborhood. Located right off the K, right across 24-hour fitness, and reasonably close to City College, it's in a pretty prime location for just about anyone. It's a very cozy cafe for people who are catching up with a friend and a great study spot for people trying to get some work done. 

More importantly, the coffee and food here is very good. I'm a huge fan of Blue Bottle coffee, and although it makes me a little sad to see Fog Lifter now using coffee from Sightglass, the coffee here is still very much worth it. Not to mention, the staff here is also super friendly and willing to help you out! Yes there are definitely better coffee shops elsewhere in the city, but still come check this place out because it's one of the better ones out in this part of the city.
author: Aaron W.

description: Fog Lifter Cafe is a great little neighborhood cafe that serves some great coffee with some basic food options. I come here quite often when I am working remotely. There is free wi-fi and plenty of outlets. The place is comfortably full with neighbors reading or SFSU or CCSF students working. BART is not a far walk and the K passes by regularly. I have to say their new orleans iced coffee is my favorite in SF. They make any drink with almond milk, which is great for me (lactose free). Their food is sandwiches, smoothies, and salads and is pretty basic, but is made fresh and served hot (well not the smoothies because that would be gross). The service is pretty chill and I really love the music that they play. I'm serious, I have never had to put my headphones in here. It's great! The bathroom can be a little untidy at times, but nothing ever too gross. One thing I really enjoy about Fog Lifter is their variety in seating. They have community tables, small tables, and really cozy chairs. There is also a little cabinet with flyers for community events. It's just a really cozy and chill place to get gooooood coffee!
author: Isabella G.

description: This is a cute little cafe. Their vegan felafel is honestly amazing. They serve it warm which is perfect for rainy foggy days in the city. I originally came here to study but my laptop died so I was unable to. Yet, they have a lot of outlets so it's a plus when you remember to bring your laptop charger. Overall great customer service plus friendly vegan food that's cheap around CCSF campus.
author: Jazmine Z.

description: This is a great and cute little coffee shop. I come here to do homework most of the time. lots of space, plugs, and the staffs are amazing. Super super nice people. two stars minus only because it's always f***ing cold and loud music quiet distracting. The food is also kinda pricy. but hey, it's a cute neighborhood coffee shop. Great coffee, btw.
author: Thyra K.

description:
Friendly service. Fresh bagels and lox. Overall a great place to start off your morning. 
And a very relaxed vibe with local neighborhood peeps.
author: The Foodie O.

description:
The coffee is good but the service and people are rude. I would not recommend this place for people that like nice service. RUDE RUDE RUDE.!!!!!!!
Also you have to buy something before using the bathroom that's just not right. I will buy some sheeeezzzzz.
author: Oscar T.

description:
Definitely the best coffee shop in the neighborhood. They sell good quality coffee. I had their iced coffee: which they cold brew with added chicory. Not my cup of tea as I like regular cold brewed. 

Came here on a Sunday morning (around 10) and no seating. So my bf and I sat outside. Luckily it was nice and sunny. I kept an eye on the barista so I can pickup my sandwiches when it was ready. He went out of the way to serve us instead; that was really nice of him. 

The sandwiches were decent. Delicious enough, but not a must-order. I would definitely come back again.
author: Lisa L.

description: I would give zero stars if possible. I came in after my workout. The cashier with a beard was extremely rude, snatched the money out of my hand. He was so rude I did not even want to eat here.
author: Maira R.

description:
Beats Starbucks, peet's and Tully anyway.
My regular is mocha! Back anytime anyway!
Nice music and great friendly community around.
Right on Ocean and very convenient. Cute bike shop also next door, 
Tatoos anyone?  also right next door!
author: Bob W.

description:
Glad to see a decent coffee shop in the area. The prior shops didn't have quality coffee so the space was always empty, until now.

Fog lifter did smtg right. Quality coffee, lounge seating, wifi ~ simple combination and customers come filling up this place every weekend.

They even have a nice parklet for additional seating outside. Nice touch!
author: Ju D.

description:
Fog Lifter Cafe:

+ good, Blue Bottle drip coffee
+ nice food selection. i had an Everything bagel w/ a Sundried Tomato spread that I believe was mixed in-house; tasted decent.
+ great place to study or relax (clean, comfortable, open space; plenty of seating and large tables; quiet)
+ nice service
author: Diane N.

description: Wonderful service from a friendly team no matter what time I come in. Fog Lifter has one of the most affordable capuccinos in the neighborhood, unlike those jerks at Java On Ocean Coffee House whose owner rips people off and charged me like $5 for a tasteless cappucino. That being said, the truth is that I do not  keep coming back over to Fog Lifter Cafe because is cheaper than its competitors, I keep coming back due to the friendly staff this shop has. I haven't seen a single frown on an employee face, doesn't matter if I come early in the morning or in the afternoon a few minutes before the time the shop closes.
author: Sylvester C.
