description: I used to come here often but recently the quality of service and food has dropped. Portions have gotten smaller and the staff has been slow. After waiting 20 mins for my food they forgot my smoothie order, no apology or anything and no sense of urgency. While waiting for my food there were several staff just standing around doing nothing. Finally after 5 mins I get my drink and again not a single apology about the long wait. I would have appreciated them telling me how long my order would take or if there is a back up of orders.
author: Jonathon T.

description:
I got out of YogaFlow and decided to stop by and grab a latte.  The downfall is that it's a one size cup across the board, thus their gluten-free chocolate chip cookie was among fairly good.  The place is great to bring a laptop and work, but not for reading a book.  
I have to say I like my latte foamy and the barista here nailed it!
author: Fabiola V.

description:
Never mind the displays of enticing cookies and pastries in the front, seductively beckoning to you in the morning when you're just trying to order a nice simple coffee. 

Never mind the coffee, the Blue Bottle drip coffee that makes you all warm and energized for the day, despite the fog rolling in every morning without fail, the coffee made by the baristas.

Never mind the baristas, the coffee masters behind the counter who are so incredibly sweet and cheerful and nice, giving you wonderful "Smile" designs in your morning latte to remind you that life is wonderful. Actually, do mind that. 

And on a more helpful note, great Wi-Fi, spacious, delicious salads.
author: Mandy C.

description: I grew up near this side of town so it makes me happy having Fog Lifter Cafe around! The owner and his pup are the sweetest! The coffee and food here is great! I usually go for their cold brew or soy latte.. it's perfect every time. Their yogurt parfaits are really really good! It sucks that I lay off the bread because they have wonderful looking sambos!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Wow. Kick-ass. Gnarly (remember this word? ). As good as it gets.

 I miss this place greatly, because it was fundamental to my survival just a short time ago when I wasn't working. Let me tell you what makes this place so fan-f'n-tastic. The workers! So much character, always cheerful, and they know their coffee beans! I like everyone that works here and they all have their own distinct personalities so you'd think an acting troupe had invaded this shop! 

This spot has it all, occasional live music, diverse recorded music (great list), corner window views of frequent Ocean Ave near-crashes with the Muni Metro, bad-ass buff dudes going into the 24HR fitness across the street (for the ladies); for the guys: gorgeous eager and inconspicuous-looking women nearby the gym. And if you want cool, older dudes living off a pension by sitting under parasols drunk on the sidewalk while listening to the Giants, yep, you have that too just up the street! Soccer moms, hipsters, and college students unite at this place where studying gets serious after 5 PM. 

With a tattoo parlor, yoga rooms, Eastern and Western (medicinal) herbal remedy places surrounding this spot, your life will enthusiastically become an Ocean Ave Bubble. 

Update: they got a cozy parklet in front! Seats! 

Wish there was more than one!
author: Peter F.

description: Wonderful customer service and delicious Salmon Avocado Panini !! This cafe is very cozy with comfy cushion chairs. It's very relaxing and it's been awhile since I've been to a cafe that hits me right in my heart. I will definitely come back. Great job guys!!
author: Karen J.

description:
This incredibly cozy cafe make me want to claim a spot and pass the hours. The incredibly friendly barista expertly hand crafted my Ethiopian slow pour coffee and told stories while she did. This is the kind of place to bring a friend for a quality conversation, to hole up with a good book, or even work on a project.

I miss this place and am looking forward to going back. I stumbled across it through Yelp and am glad to be able to turn around and strengthen the profile. Well worth a visit.
author: Michael A.

description: Now serving Sightglass coffee.... the drip coffee was too acidic for me, and the cookie  was really sad. The gingersnap cookie was super old.. as it wasn't even chewy anymore.. more like very dry and crumbly. The pastries in the case also didn't look too appetizing... as they looked more than a day old. Place also closes at 7:00 on a friday night.... I had to relocate somewhere else to study. Not the best.
author: Eleana H.

description: I tried this place for the first time today and I have a cafe crush. As soon as I walked in I felt cozy and welcome. The staff was smiling and that's a nice change from the norm at a lot of cafes. I was planning on getting a latte and decided to ask the barista her favorite drink, and she recommended the almond milk cappuccino. I went for it and was SO glad I did. It was so rich, I couldn't believe it was almond milk. It was perfect! I also ordered an everything bagel with cream cheese and it really hit the spot. Unfortunately, I didn't have time to hang around, but I really wanted to. Lots of seating, plenty of it comfy looking, and a device on the wall telling you to go ahead and play your own music FOR FREE!! If I ever get around to writing that novel (about what, I have no idea), I will head to Fog Lifter to do it. I'm excited to have discovered this place!
author: Liz M.

description: Friendly service, great coffee varieties, and bathroom available for customers.  I always change up what coffee to get based on mood. Music is a nice compliment. Wait time is inevitable considering there's only 2 workers and sometimes 1. Some people need to be more patient.
author: Jinnie L.

description:
Selfishly, I am afraid to give this place five stars because it might get busier... love the chai; not too sweet for me.  It's a quaint place with comfy chairs and small tables to do work.  

One of my favorites.
author: Cass H.

description: Locally owned. Very classy. Generous hours and lovely food and coffee -- you can't ask for more. You will be welcomed here :)
author: B K.

description: ~What happened? Maybe I caught Fog Lifter on a bad day, so don't go when it's crowded in the morning. I went for my new Orleans iced coffee and I was all excited, only to find that it tasted like dirty dish water and I couldn't even drink it. I was so sad, that used to be my favorite drink ever, so I forlornly threw my $3.50 wasted coffee drink in the trash and went to get an iced coffee at Quickly's for $1-sadly, it tasted better. Very nicepeopke and a great cafe normally.~
author: Sarah C.

description:
Excellent service by blond girl and dark hair guy!

Mochas come with TCHO chocolate, yes!! Excellent, Mocha on the second try.
I sat here all of sunday studying (free wifi). outdoor & indoor seating was great. 
Ordered a quiche for $5 and it came with a salad, all delicious and fairly priced.

nice crowd, not too busy, just enough. Great atmosphere.

Loved it here.

Their cookies look like the BEST cookies on the planet. Try one and let me know how they are!

Also, they have blue bottle coffee
author: Grilled O.

description: Waited 25 minutes from placing order to getting food. We'd only ordered oatmeal and an egg and cheese croissant. Had a too sweet smoothie that tasted like they use syrup instead of fresh/frozen fruit. Staff was pleasant but overall a disappointing experience.
author: Linda P.

description: Good coffee drinks...and great sandwiches!  And I love the interior of this place...it's a great place to hang...something I wish I could do more often.  But...I have to confess.  I probably get treated better here than many as my daughter works here!  So...my review is biased...which is why I only am giving 4 stars...
author: Richard J.

description: I came in around 8:30am on a Tuesday, the staff was very friendly and smiley. Jenny was my barista and poured a delicious drip of one of Sightglass Coffee's darker roasts. You know it's a good cup of joe when you don't have to pour milk and sugar in it! The space is great for doing work or simply sitting and watching passerby's, the bathrooms were clean, and the condiment station was fully stocked. Pay a visit, you won't be disappointed!
author: Kimberly R.

description: Its a monday afternoon and I came in and the first thing I asked is if they have a restroom. someone helped me and handed me the key attached with humongous spoon. It put a smile on my face as the restroom is way decent for anyone to use. As I returned it, I was tryin to get something to drink and eat before I die myself from hunger. I stood there looking at the menu looking confused on the menu (if youre not a regular, which unfortunately I am not) and not even one offer from the staff to help me figure out what I want. I ended up getting something safe to get so I got myself a tea. cold weather, hot beverage.. boom. but thats not the end of it. As I didnt know that there are types of teas to choose from and their menu for the tea was another battle for me to fight on. I thought I won and its all over but, its just getting started. took me another minute to decide and this lady staff in front of me looked like she tired of her work or doesnt wanna work in there no more. blank staring me like "order already.. geeez" kinda face. I decided to get whatever and I decided to get a bagel for my tummy. suddenly she uttered, "we dont do bagels no more" and I was confused as I see lots of bagels in front of me and didnt fully understood what she mean so I asked her to repeat what she said and meant they dont toast or warm up the bagel no more. I flared up inside as I try to shout inside my head bout what kind of coffee shop is this who sells bagel but dont warm them up? but because im starving, theres no way i would hate and not eat a cold bagel. I could take the cold bagel cause im pretty sure shes colder than it and im happy im not getting her but the less colder bagel instead. she sounded surprise that I still want em even if they were cold. she has the look on her face that I am really making her work and its pissing her off. finalized everything and i thought its all done yet again, as I paid, i was asked for my signature and whooosh, she flipped the iPad in front of her and wow! if its not attached to the base of it, she wouldve sent it away flying. well, that all leaves me for not givin any tip. must be harsh for me as I know that I need to give tip but with all that, i cant. sorry but not sorry as she is not either. ate my food and left.
author: Ian N.

description:
Decided to stop here after hitting up CVS across the way. 
I got the coffee and the zucchini bread-both delicious, and a nice balance of bitter and sweet. I am really digging the drip coffee they made...
I should stop here more often.
author: Rose M.

description:
Pour-over coffee from Sightglass! Tasty soups by Blue Dish Catering, including vegan and gluten free options, quality fresh made sammies like the salmon avocado panini and the chicken breast with melted provolone. The food is a notch above the rest and yet Fog Lifter Cafe doesn't put on airs. 

This independent, cheerful hangout is a work place for locals, with WiFi and a chill enviro to hang out or catch up with a friend, read or surf and listen to some good tunes in the background. The art on the walls is all by locals and it's mostly for sale. 
Foglifter Cafe has a heart, you can feel the beat and it will win yours. I'm following on Twitter, are you?  @FoglifterCafe
author: Roanna Z.

description: They only serve blue bottle coffee - in usual blue bottle one size only - and I'm not a blue bottle fan (tastes sour to me). Otherwise I'd give them an extra star. Food is ok, decent selection of pastries/sandwiches. Strengths are location and wifi.
author: p f.

description: Im back again with a lucky parking space in front. I ordered the sandwich panini with a cup of coffee for just over $11.00.
author: Kevin L.

description: I really do like this place. The only complaint I have is every time I come here for a sandwich or salad it takes forever. So if your in a hurry. Don't eat here. Everything else is perfect.
author: Dani G.

description:
This was a new place that I found on my way to work.  I'm a fan of the parklet outside as it would be a great place to sit and relax on a nice sunny day.  The inside of the cafe is great too, with free wifi.
Their food and drinks were good.  I'd definitely come back to do work or study.
author: Serena L.

description: Staff here is extremely unhelpful.  Went in to do some work, wifi wasn't working, and they refused to reset the router or help in any way.
author: Hung N.

description:
Laptop camper here. Fog Lifter Café took over a place I've camped at numerous times; it's still a good spot for camping (free wi-fi, outlets, quiet, easy parking) and lingering. I think it's the only place in the area that serves Blue Bottle Coffee. They have paninis, soup, smoothies and pastries.

* West Coast scramble: Bagel with egg and cheese needed salt and pepper.  Greasy and bland.
* Latte: it's Blue Bottle but the latte had a bitter aftertaste, not well made

It's spacious with plenty of small tables. I wouldn't go there on a warm day because the windows make it feel like a greenhouse inside. Best on foggy days.

You know you love me. X0 X0, laptop camper.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Great cafe! Coffee here is really great and the place has a good layout for just hanging out and working / studying / relaxing. 

This place is a real gem. The food is good too!
author: Sven S.

description: Chill vibe, Blue Bottle coffee (and a generous portion at that) -- great place. Lots of open space so great to work or have a meeting.
author: Mel G.

description: I have been coming here for years after the gym for coffee. I finally tried the food and I have been missing out all these years!!!!! BOMB! I ordered the smoked salmon avocado on dutch, and it was so good I am craving one now. They use this delicious garlic spread that can make anything taste good, its awesome! Huge fan I will be ordering more for dine in and to go from here on out! If you are in the area, MUS TRY!
author: Ed S.

description: Latte was great, with cute latte art! Bagels were nothing special though.
author: Lexy P.

description:
I came here with my old dude friend.
Two old men sitting by the window having late morning coffee.
The dripping coffee was really good.
I really liked the sesame bagel with smoked salmon.
The pastrami panini was awesome!
The service was friendly, comfortable seats and there is a clean bathroom and every thing but that's not all, there was more.
A yoga studio up stairs! 
I saw many ladies holding a yoga-matt with yoga-outfit walking by! 
And few of them came in here to get smoothy or something.
What a "Yatta" moment for a straight dirty old man! Mmmm, mmm
So, I was singing this song.
I'm A Girl Watcher!
Btw, I am not anti-gay.

I'm a girl watcher
I'm a girl watcher
Watchin' girls go by
My, my, my

I'm a girl watcher
I'm a girl watcher
Here comes one now
Mmmm, mmm, mmm

I am just a dog
When I threw away my toys
I found a new pastime
To dwell on

Whenever I detect
Members of the other sex
I play the game I do so well, oh

I'm a girl watcher
I'm a girl watcher
Watchin' girls go by
My, my, my

I'm a girl watcher
I'm a girl watcher
Here comes one now

Hello there, female
My, my, but you do look swell
Could you please walk
A little slower

I wonder if you know
That you're putting on a show
Could you please walk
A little closer

I'm a girl watcher
I'm a girl watcher
Watchin' girls go by
My, my, my

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=raJWuz7qQVc

Great spot! I'll definitely go back!
author: Nobu K.

description: Great neighborhood cafe. The sun-dried tomato spread bagel is amazing.
author: J. C. B.

description: This cafe serves Blue Bottle coffee and good quality teas.  The manual slow drip coffee filter cones were a nice touch. They appeared to have a good sandwich selection, and I'd like to go back and try for lunch.  Cool vibes, really helpful and friendly baristas, and cool spot to just chill solo or with a friend.  We were approached by one of the patron's doing research on happiness for a future book which led to interesting conversations.  Overall really enjoyed my experience, my hot tea, and the company.
author: Nova P.

description: I went here last Sunday with my fiancé. My fiancé ordered our food so they did not see me at the cashier. Very rude servers! I had to use the restroom & was told it's for customers only & I had to order to be able to use it coz it has keys etc.. I had to tell them I am a customer & the way the short frizzy hair woman with tattooes all over her body talked to me was so belittling.
author: Janie A.

description:
I really enjoy shops who use the Square as their operating system for their registers since I don't always carry cash with me. However, I know better than to pay with my card next time. 

I gave a small 15% tip for my purchase because the girl who helped us took in my order fairly quickly and the transaction went smoothly. There wasn't anything wrong with the food I ordered but they weren't anything special either. When my food finally came the staff didn't package up my food to go like I asked for which isn't a big deal but after packing up my food, they completely forgot about the second half of my order. "Oh right..." was their response and they produced the food not long after. 

Now I know to put in tips AFTER I receive my order even though ordering food to go usually doesn't require a tip. However, I cannot blame the staff entirely for their mistakes. There was a customer/friend/some ONE the staff knew on a personal level who was HANGING OUT and chit chatting with them (more like distracting them) as they were working. This guy had the need to station himself at the doorway where the staff walks in and out from behind the counter onto the cafe floor. When their barista was trying to deliver a cup of cappuccino to a customer, he had to maneuver himself to the side because this "customer" didn't understand to get the hell out of the way. 

Come on dude, seriously?? No matter what your relationship is with the staff, how could you not understand they were working?? The next time I visit the cafe I really hope not to see this customer again since his presence affected the staff's quality of service. Hang out with your friends outside of work, not as their working.
author: Fanny W.

description:
I live Downtown, nowhere near this cafe, I was with A friend yesterday driving by, asked if they could pull over real quick so I could just hop out & grab some java . . . . . . H O L Y  R U S T E D  M E T A L  B A T M A N!!!!!!!

I took A picture of my beautiful chocolate/coffee heaven cause it had three little stars in the froth, pretty so pretty :o]
I now know All about Blue Bottle, I wish Id gotten the name of the cute barrista w/the shaggy hair who created something almost too gorgeous to drink, so that I could praise him here. I have NEVER tasted A mocha this good & I have had some seriously fantastic delicious coffee in my time. 
Now I will forever be dreaming of fog lifters & most likely always  be trying to justify going all the way to the other side of town . . . . . . .  for coffee   lol

OMG OMG update . . . . I just saw the Bunny pictures!!!!!!! Bunny Froth!!! Im jealous! Time to go back
author: A L.

description: I'm a student that goes to SFSU so not that far from the cafe however this place has an average tasting Mocha for my taste. Service the staff was welcoming and the prep time for my drink was not that long! The ambiance is just what a typical cafe should be like very cozy and calm. Lots of tables for everyone to find somewhere to sit and also very clean area c: this is my first time coming and I would say I would come back!
author: Jose J.

description: This place surprised me. The atmosphere was chill and quiet enough to do homework or study. I ordered a smoked turkey provolone panini. Honestly he sandwich didn't taste as good as it looked. They panini pressed it with the lettuce inside so the vegetables were all soggy. I gave the cafe a 4 star review for its environment. My friends bought the drinks and they enjoyed them and their deserts looked delicious.
author: Arthur O.

description:
Did I really think getting out of the house and away from my normal distractions would really help me do my homework? 

I have been here for hours and all I've done is open the web page my homework instructions are written on. Never fails. Street parking was easy to find and free on Sunday. For a place called "Fog Lifter" it sure is located where the sun don't shine and its an amazingly nice and sunny day here in San Francisco. 

I got a Salmon Avocado Panini and a Mango Tango smoothie. For a $10 sandwich, I would expect real avocado instead of some weird watered down avocado spread. The sandwich was mediocre and over priced. The smoothie didn't seem like it was blended really well. The first half tasted only of yogurt and the second half tasted heavily of honey. Bleh. 

They have the coolest "pour over" coffee maker. You get to watch them make it right before your eyes. As the guy working there said, "Its like a coffee maker without the maker. I'm the maker." Haha. Service is okay, definitely wouldn't say friendly at all though. 

The space is beautiful. Its one of the few nice places in the area. Its nice to finally see a good business located in this space after seeing countless ones open and close in a matter of months. Its huge and bright. Makes me feel like the beach should be across the street. 

Free Wifi is a plus but there was no paper towels or soap in the bathroom. Come on guys! Basic necessities here. 

I might check out Java on Ocean before coming back here but its good for what it is. I just wouldn't order anymore food.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Nice atmospheric cafe in San Francisco's Ingleside district. The average hipster transplants should feel right at home here if they are craving a "genuine" SF experience thanks to the constant overcast and the intermittent rumbling of Muni street cars. Drinking PBR's in Dolores Park is still the gold standard, though.

I've here twice to catch up on some work remotely, but I can only halfheartedly recommend this spot for studying since they sometime play jarring death metal music at volume levels which I consider above reasonable. There are a decent amount of plugs for your laptop, but not nearly enough to cover a majority of the tables. On that note, some of the tables are quite wobbly and need their legs adjusted.

Still, this would be a great spot to meet up a friend for a quick hangout. Unfortunately the two times I was here, the coffee was sour. But their food smells good, though. Free WiFi is also a plus.
author: William C.

description: If you're looking to get work done in peace and quiet, Fog Lifter isn't ideal. The Muni train runs along the block and they play their music pretty loud. Otherwise, they have a pretty decent menu with variety of sandwiches and drinks. There is an ample amount of tables and seats which is great if you're meeting with a group of friends.
author: Glecie C.

description:
Finally, REAL coffee in this 'hood.  No more having to scramble up $1.65 for below sub-par, way below mediocre coffee. I'd rather pay double the price and come here for BLUE BOTTLE!!!

Imagine.. You can have Blue Bottle coffee right after the gym, or right before hopping on the Muni to get to work.

Heavenly. 

Well, minus the MUNI part. 

The owners are very friendly and they have done an amazing job remodeling this place. Love it.

P.S. $5 minimum for credit/debit card! Just a reminder for those of you like me who don't carry much cash.
author: Susy C.

description: 30 mins for 2 bagels and dry oatmeal. I have been coming to this cafe ever since it opened. Not the first time I've received my order in an untimely manner. Bummed that the service continues to suck. I'll take my business to Philz up the street from now on.
author: Melissa P.

description:
I come here to study every once in a while. I love the iced white mocha and their sandwiches are pretty yummy as well. Dig the free wi-fi too! The workers are also super nice.
Stay away so that it doesn't become over-crowded! Please? :)
author: Karen C.

description:
I'm glad something like this finally opened up in the neighborhood! This place is a huge contrast to the cafe that was here previously, much more modern and welcoming. The quality of the coffee is better since they serve Blue Bottle coffee here and the pastries are DELICIOUS. Most of the pastries are from Sweet Mill, which I've never heard of  before but I'm a new fan now.

The location is excellent since it's right on the corner and the cafe has huge windows, allowing the light to really shine through so the space feels open. Ocean Avenue is a relatively quiet street and fellow patrons at the cafe tend to be mellow, so this place is an ideal place to do work. They do offer free wifi and there are several outlets around the cafe, although there could always be more. 

I usually don't hang out in cafes, usually just running in and out to grab coffee when I'm on the go, but I definitely see myself hanging out at this cafe regularly now since it's so close to my house and quiet enough for me to do work at.
author: Le D.

description:
Bravo to Chelsea and Ryan!!!! Not so much for that one girl... Read on!

Why?

On Saturday (Jan 25, 14), my bf and I decided to find a new spot for us to get some work done with hopes to make this our new cafe. Like every serious person who likes to get out of the house, get work/study done, find a yummy and healthy cafe, with awesome wifi along with great smoothies/caffeine fix, bright, airy, lots of windows, open space, and friendly attentive staff that seems to really enjoy themselves? (Btw, we always drive by this cafe to and from WholeFoods and 24).

Here's what happened. The bf and I knocked out a ton of work from 3-8pm closing. We were exhausted by the time we left, our brains were fried. We left and didn't realized till Sunday (yesterday morning) that my bf had left his laptop case, inside was the battery charger (super awesome battery charger that can charge multiple devices at once even iPad and laptop without having to recharge it after...I gave him for Christmas!!!). 

I called around 11am, someone answered that seemed very mellow and tired. I mentioned that we were the last of two couple that left before closing. I even in detailed told her where we were sitting (two square tables put together before the window table next to the armoire with magazines/flyers) told her my bf left his laptop case on the chair that he had tucked in. Not even a hold or, "let me check," she just said (and I knew she didn't look for it)."no there's nothing here." Great! She seemed unhelpful. Being that my bf is a patient man, he was understanding of their situation, (the bf: "I remember retail, they're not going to look for it, they're busy or something.")

And me...I rarely take no for an answer, I called just about under 5 minutes later with hopes to speak to someone else that was more awake and helpful.

I forgot her name but after asking questions she was one of the two girls that was tending the cafe on Saturday. I asked her the same, she said no and it wasn't there, but was more responsive and asked for my number in case she finds it. I asked if she was the girl with the beanie that closed and she said, "no that was Chelsea I didn't close." I knew then she was the other girl that was there with Chelsea, but remembered it was only Chelsea closing and asking us if we needed to throw anything away from our table. I knew that if I talked to Chelsea she would have remembered us, after all there were only two couple that stayed till closing.

We then decided to stop by around 1pm or so. My bf went in and approached a guy name Ryan, and miraculously Ryan knew exactly what my bf had left and mentioned that Chelsea found it last night and Ryan opened the cafe earlier. Ryan went by the back area (kitchen) and my bf's laptop case and expensive battery charger was inside it! Viola! It was there! Maybe is was a miscommunication on some of the staff, but it was night and day between the 1st girl who answered, to the second girl, then Ryan in person. 

Bravo to Ryan and Chelsea for not being dishonest and helpful. 

From the 5 hours of experience at Cafe Fog Lifter, although I didn't interact  much with Chelsea or come to the front register area (the bf took care of that for me), I'm an observer and being in the PR/Marketing field, Chelsea is good for your business. She was very interactive with everyone, she walked around the cafe, cleaning, changing the music station, making small talks and was overall a breath of fresh air to hear/see.

My bf and I plan to come back soon to thank Chelsea and hangout for a few hours and enjoy our day, maybe not work for too long this time.

Oh, I can't forget about their tasty and healthy choices of food, blue bottle coffe, drip coffee and cozy atmosphere. Fast wifi, too!

Anyone can open a cafe, but not everyone is lucky enough to have it all. 

Cheers!
author: Jules V.

description: First time at The Fog Lifter after passing by it every morning on the way work and the drip coffee was definitely better than expected. Def coming back some more.
author: Blossom W.

description:
I always hit the Americanos up here.  I wonder which coffee they use in their espresso machine...also blue bottle... I dunno?  

The Americano is more consistently good than Java on Ocean up the street which is generally too watery.

The employees are super friendly and the place is clean and well laid out. It's almost a tad too sanitary/organized for a cafe!

They really need to turn the music down and change the channel though, not sure why they picked a steady stream of blasting pop music.  I rarely can find a seat and have never found a couch/armchair.  Other than that this place is a total winner.  Cool to sit al fresco on a nice day too!
author: Brian L.

description:
I choose Fog Lifter out of the cafe's in this area of Ocean for the following reasons:

1. Friendly service. I think the guys that work here are friendlier than some of the other cafes on Ocean which can be borderline clueless.
2. 24Hour Fitness across the street. Sometimes a drip coffee is all the motivation you need.

If you come in have a quiche or a breakfast burrito. Ryan makes a great iced latté. An Ingleside neighborhood staple.
author: Charles S.

description:
FINALLY! Thank you Fog Lifter for being the first decent, walkable coffee shop to open in my neighborhood. No offense to some of the other dingier businesses along Ocean...

+ Good Blue Bottle Coffee
+ Fast, free Wi-Fi
+ Lots of outlets and tables
+ A great study space
+ Good cafe food
+ A surprisingly bright and open space with big windows (to see the fog)

- I wish you were open later than 8 pm
- If you also had beer on tap, I'd love you even more
author: Lisa N.

description:
Me being a huge sucker for cafes in SF I decided to check this place out! Also a friend showed me their cute latte art which was a mega incentive for me to go! 

The atmosphere is really chill, reminds me of the cafes back in South America! Staff is super friendly and dont make me feel rushed like a few places I have been to. 

They serve blue bottle coffee so that was a big plus also drip coffee, I am sold!

Also their latte art is amazing! Each art is unique! Their food is really good too, I recommend the chicken breast panini! Super amazing and delish!! 

I will def come back here again!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
You would think for a guy who comes here all the time that I would give the place a higher rating. I'm literally here every other day. I would love to give Fog Lifter at least 4 stars, but lately I've developed a love/hate relationship with the place.

The people who work there are great, friendly, and courteous. The internet is fantastic. The snacks and tea are decent, though just a smidge on the pricey side. The atmosphere is fantastic for chatting with random strangers or working and listening to great tunes. I've made friends with most of the employees there and had some great discussions on life and what not with them. 

So here's the deal breaker. When I go to a place I don't want to be breathing the exhaust from what's being cooked and walk out of the place stinking to high hell. Especially, when I have to run out to an important meeting or something. Unfortunately, this has been happening all too often lately. I see a fan up near the ceiling and it doesn't get turned on to help with the ventilation. This is problematic and  I'm starting to loathe coming here. I hope they can solve the situation soon. 

I've been a loyal patron and my loyalty is being tested :(
author: Ehb T.

description: I am a regular here - mostly for the coffee and sometimes their bagel options. I started coming here after a bad experience with my previous cafe and am overall happy. That being said, it depends on the staff for me. I often come here in the morning before work and when the owner is in with his regular staff, I love this place. They know my order and are always very friendly. However, there is a specific girl who sometimes runs things and when she is there, I hate ordering. She's complimented my purse several times but never remembers my order. This morning I ordered an iced latte to bring on MUNI like I usually do and only after did she inform me that the cafe was out of straws and smiled as if it happened all the time.
author: Tatiana G.

description:
Love that they serve Blue Bottle Coffee here! 

I come here a lot to study. There are a lot of space available plus free wifi. Sometimes the wifi doesn't connect so you have to ask the staff to reset the router (happened to me a few times). So save your work, in case something happens! There's also plenty of free parking in the area so you don't have to worry about the meter. 

I like how it's also across from 24hr fitness. Makes it convenient when I want to get my homework & workout done on the same day.
author: Cara N.

description: I have never given any restaurant or business in general a bad review because quiet honestly I know how social media can ruin someone's reputation and I also understand that opinions are subjective. However, with that said, I couldn't ignore how I was treated today at Fog Lifter Cafe.  I come here at least 3x per week to get coffee for myself and bagels for the kids. Today, I went in with my 4 yo and ordered us lunch. When we sat down, my son noticed that there are samples of pound cake next to the register and asked me to grab him one little sample. He ate it and asked me to grab one more, when I took the second one, I was told (in a condescending way) that it's one per customer (to which I explained, I'm one costumer and my son is another costumer). Her attitude was beyond rude and when I came up to the "supervisor", Erica, her attitude wasn't any better. As I tried to explain to her that this is no way to treat a respectable/repeat customer, she basically walked away from me as if she doesn't hear what I'm saying. Neither my son or I ate our lunch (which I spent over $25 for and left a 20% tip), I paid prior to this incident, and we both walked out of there. I'm appalled by this. This is beyond rude and I have never been treated this way. I hope something is done about this, not for me as I will never step foot in that place, but so others don't get to experience what I experienced today.
author: Marina G.

description: This place is one of my fave cafes. They have good food, a cool vibe, and a kind staff. Oh, and their drip coffee?! Dee-lish! I'll be back soon Fog Lifter!
author: Steph L.

description:
I am not a coffee drinker so I do not know how to judge on the quality of their coffee drinks so my rating is for other things that gives this cafe a 5 star rating.

The staff members are really nice! Nice and warm greeting when I order my drink and recieve my drink. Happy staff team shows they enjoy working there and makes the cafe environment even better.

I come here to study and it is a good cafe to study in. Of course there are folks who get drinks and carry on conversations at the cafe, but it their conversations are not obviously loud or anything like that so volume wise, I can study here. Furthermore when people get phone calls (and they are considerate of other people at the cafe), they take their phone calls outside. Keep in mind, not everyone is that considerate and sometimes some folks do talk loudly and talk on their phones at the cafe too.

There are many tables and chairs available for meet ups, studying, etc. There are wall outlets to charge your devices. There are large windows so you can easily look outside.

The cafe is neatly and cleanly organized. The seating area, food preparation area, and the bathroom is clean. Clean places are always a thumb up for me!!

Even though I am not a coffee drink, I do like the drinks I have tries so far: hot chocolate, dark roast drip coffee, and latte.

Lastly, this cafe is across the street from 24 hour so after my study session in the cafe, I walk across the street to the gym!
author: Shirley M.

description: Eh for the price and pretty limited selection of sandwiches/breakfast foods, it's a decent cafe to stop in and grab something. There wasn't a size option for my chai tea and it was quite expensive for the size.
author: Walt W.

description: This place is HORRIBLE! I was recommended by a friend and went in deciding to skip Noahs  for the first time for a lox bagel. BIG MISTAKE! The owner was at the register. I ordered the lox bagel. I asked if I could have half hummus and half cream cheese. The owner told me he didn't want to do it because the hummus was runny and sloppy when you put it on the bagel. I told him all they needed to do was cut it in half and do the spreads. So he rang it in. I asked for it scooped. He rolled his eyes... and rang that in. I could see is customer service skills lacked big time. He tells me the total is 10 something. The bagel was $7.75 plus he was charging me $2 for the hummus lol. Okay fine. I questioned the displayed price of the bagel. It said it was $6.75 for the entire lox bagel with everything.  He showed me the itemized pricing which said: $2 for the onion bagel, $4.75 for the lox and toppings and $1 for cream cheese which totaled $7.75.  The price that said LOX BAGEL with cucumbers, capers, red onions, lox and cream cheese read $6.75 and I was asking him why am I getting charged an extra $1 ? He said for the bagel. I explained to him the menu read LOX BAGEL with the toppings for $6.75 which means it comes with everything it says on his menu for $6.75.. nowhere does it say the bagel is extra. Then his employee behind him said "that's what you get" very rudely. Who owns a business  and allows their employees to bad mouth a customer?! I said nothing to her she looked like she came from a dumpster anyways, like she didnt shower. I asked him to honor the price it says. He said he would change it later but he's not going to do anything about it now and can't change the price.. I told him I run restaurants for a living and when we advertise something on our menu for a price we have to honor it and that's what his menu read. IT GETS BETTER!  He then turns around pointing to a sign saying he is refusing service to me and has the right to... After being rude to me as a first time customer, trying to be lazy just because hummus gets gloppy, rolling his eyes, letting his employee badger me, false advertising, not honoring posted prices he then refuses service to me. I have written one yelp review in my life but  told him I would write one as i proceed to walk out. OH FOR SURE. And as im walking out he continues to yell at me saying "oh yea?! another yelp review!" I have never in my life experienced anyone so miserable that acts like that to someone who is starting their day and contributing to their business. It was the most horrifying experience i have ever had. I have been in the restaurant industry managing fast casual to huge 400 seating fine dining restaurants for the last 15 years with hundreds of employees. If I could give 0 stars would. He and his staff lack serious customer service and business skills. No wonder they are stuck working at a coffee shop. Needless to say I will NEVER go back again and I am going to spread the word that false advertising, attitude and allowing your staff to attack your customer is not the way you run your business. Customers help your business stay afloat. They are in your house. You honor what you advertise and you give service with a smile. Customer service is about a happy business exchange. You people should learn the key to customer service which is believe, listen, apologize,satisfy, and thank and I definitely did not get any of that. For every one customer that has a bad experience, they are going to tell as many people as they can not to go there. As a business, fighting over a $1 to keep all the customers you would be losing is not worth  it... that's REAL business thinking. Now look, here I am writing a yelp review because of how I was treated when it could have been easily resolved if they knew how to handle the situation. They keep it going that way they will eventually go under. Greed is not the way you execute. Karma will come back to bite them. UNPROFESSIONAL.  I went to Java Beach Cafe they are better SERVICE FOOD  and PRICES and with a smile
author: Nory M.

description: I came here one Sunday night to their open mic, and I was pleased. I liked their mocha latte with foam on top. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming with the employees being super nice and helpful. I suggest giving the employees a little extra tip. I hope they have more open mic nights.
author: Paul V.

description: Friendly service. Good cup of joe. Pick up a quick breakfast or juice.  Nice bright space.
author: Heather R.

description:
Clearing the fog.

Woke up with one of those will I ever wake up feelings.

One Blue Bottle themed Americano from Fog Lifter gave me my answer: Yes. Appreciated the extra shot of sugar free vanilla when I said it needed more.

Sipped between bites of a lowfat yogurt parfait topped with boysenberries. Perfect.

Seeing as this yelp is coming at 4am might be back again tomorrow.
author: Jason B.

description:
Sweet spot of chilling: 1-2 hours

If you are trying to squeeze this in while waiting for your muni, you will miss the train. Not the fastest most efficient place, very small business type processes. That can be nice for some. But not for a yuppie commuter. Neighborhood desperately needs a Starbucks. We have 2 cannabis dispensaries but no Starbucks for Christ Sakes! 

Where this place soars: If you like hipsterish new age-y music and want to hear music that you heard in DRIVE or on HBO's Girls then this place is the right energy.
author: Nathaniel G.

description:
This place is so inviting and great to sit in. I'm not a big coffee drinker, so I can't speak to that, but their chai lattes are so good (when the right person makes them).

I've come in here a couple times to study, and I've felt so comfortable. The WiFi is good, the people are really chill, they have food should get hungry. I ordered an avocado and salmon panini, and it was delicious.

My only complaint is that sometimes the music is too loud and tends on the weird side. I guess it depends on who's in charge that day, but once a song started out with 30 seconds of just static-y whispering, which drove me insane.
author: Trisha K.

description:
I tested out this cafe because I need a place to be productive and as a student at CCSF this place was a contender because of it's proximity and let me tell you I loved it!  They have plenty of seating, and the tables are beautiful. They have a fair amount of outlets so if you're typing an essay you can stay here for a bit. 

I bought a vanilla tea and an apricot square so I wouldn't feel like a freeloader and they were both delicious. In order to pay with a card you have to spend over $5 or $6 and if you get what I ordered then you're good to go. 

A couple of other yelpers mentioned that the music is a bit loud. I don't have this problem. I went there to read my textbooks and I had absolutely no problems concentrating, and there was a decent amount of people and the noise level was still fine for me. 

All in all I love this place!
author: Cristina H.

description:
I am such a fan of this place. Great food and coffee to fuel your work sessions. Lots of light. The most friendly crowd that regulars the place and the staff is THE NICEST and most sweet. They're very thoughtful and just genuinely cool personalities. They seem to all get along which makes it even more of an enjoyable place to be. 

I'm a fan. 

I usually get the Salmon Avocado Panini as a salad - delicious.
author: Courtney P.

description: They refuse to let u order expresso  to-go,  you must drink it in-house. New policy they implemented. i used come here all the time and i always ordered my expresso to go. I mean for $3, you'd think it would cover a cup to go. I don't  understand this reasoning and won't be back until this changes.
author: Aych K.

description:
I stopped for lunch in this area last week and was lured by a window sign saying here saying they serve Blue Bottle coffee here. I read the buzz about this label elsewhere on Yelp and had to give it a try.

They served four different brews, and I was recommended the Bella Donovan brew as a first-timer. It was good, will make me want to try the other ones when I'm around this area.

They also serve sandwiches, soup, and such here. It looks like a good place for those also during lunch.
author: H K.

description: . Great location and good drink options. However They have forgotten to put my order through two separate times in the past month, leaving me to wait around until finally I get up and remind them
author: Shannon B.

description: I absolutely love this cafe. So glad it moved in the neighborhood. Really brings up the moral. Love the Blue bottle coffee and the friendly service and clean beautiful atmosphere. If you near ocean avenue looking for coffee it's worth skipping Starbucks!!
author: Missy C.

description:
Delicious coffee and food. The staff are friendly and knowledgable about their food. 

I had the north beach panini with portobello mushroom and it was delicious! I've also had the Mediterranean one with spinach. I'm not a vegetarian but they are SOOO delicious I could be! 

I'm a Starbucks fan but am more than happy to support a local business as terrific as this one!
author: Melinda C.

description: It was a nice coffee shop. Only problem is every time I go there, they forget my order. I end up waiting 30 to 40 minutes for a bagel and even when I tried to change my order, they didn't refund my money. Coffee didn't taste that great to me, maybe I'll give this place another shot but I'm not rushing to this cafe for coffee and breakfast since they disappointed me twice.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
I live so close to this cute coffee house, and I love to do my work here. The cafe they serve always surprise me. There's one time I got a bear on top of my mocha, and i got a bonny another time!! They totally made my day. But because I go here often, so I noticed that not everyone will do the special shape....kind pity!
I love here, but I have to say sometimes the cooking smell is a little bit annoyed to me, and it's chill inside, so I always wear my coat on. Even they have those drawbacks, here is still my first choice! :)
author: Vicki F.

description: Great location on Ocean. They have a parklet in front, are right across from my gym (24 hr), and serve sightglass! Prices are very reasonable. What more does one need?Service friendly, casual. Crowd casual, laptopers, and neighborhood regulars, students likely from City College. I had a Gibraltar rightfully served in cafe only. It was great. I have visited other cafes in the area, but this hits my sweet spot in quality beans, convenient location, great space.
author: E. W.

description: This was a disappointment. My chai latte tastes like steamed milk with barely any chai, if any. The carrot cake, however, was quite tasty and sweet. I just wish I had ordered a coffee instead. $3.50 for that chai was not worth it at all :(
author: Anna O.

description:
Great place to get some great coffee and also another reason why Ocean Ave is pickin' up as one of the cool spots to hang out and/or study. 

Obviously as you can tell by many of the reviews here that the coffee is sourced from blue bottle and surprisingly priced quite nicely. The espresso is fantastic, brewed with a wonderfully creamy head and their regular coffees are brewed by the cup (which is a superb method, making every cup unique and perfect). But this isn't a blue bottle review! 

Anyway the owner is a real swell guy (and I'm not just sayin' that cause he's also my neighbor haha) who was at the front when the store just opened. Now its manned by a motley crew of baristas who, although quite efficient at what they do, are a bit on the icey side. For being people who work at coffee shops, they often look as if they could use a cup themselves now and again. Someone noted in their review below that they are sort of mean hipsters...I wouldn't go that far but I would recommend that they certainly work on bringing energy to what they do. 

(I, being a poor college student, also find myself working as a barista so I know the importance of a good attitude and demeanor when making coffee for folks in need of their own perk up)

The sandwiches are really fantastic too: fresh ingredients, well made, and sizable. Can't complain. 

Place offers wifi to go with their brew and also occasionally host great live music so I recommend stickin' around and havin' a chill out as you might get lucky and see some live music! 

In summation: great coffee, great food, great vibe. -1 star for rather lack luster employees.

Definitely a recommended place!
author: Dzu N.

description:
Overall, I enjoyed this cafe. The coffee was nice but not quite standard blue bottle quality. I like the free wifi...I recommend they lower the volume of music. 

The staff is nice. :)
author: Mr. Bill S.

description: Always out of something.... bagels , turkey etc. Coffee use to be good but recently it has been a weird acidic flavor. Use to go because it was close by but I think I would prefer Starbucks ( which is eehhh too) but at least I know what I am getting.
author: Sarah P.

description: I've lived around this area for over 25 years, but I never visited this place before today. I always go to the Vietnamese restaurant across the street for lunch. The other day we passed by again and I said to my daughter, lets go there next time. So, today we gave it a try. Just like most cafes, there are a lot of young people with laptops and stuff. We went there after lunch time, so there were plenty of seats available for the three of us. We ordered 3 panini (North beach, Roast Beef and Chicken) for each of us and a drink. It was very hot today, we didnt get any hot drinks. I'll definitely try the coffees next time. So, we ordered our food and the total came up more than I expected.. Then I asked the lady for the receipt, but she didn't give it to me, i don't know why. Well, I thought, let me talk to my son, maybe I was wrong. We only ordered 3 sandwiches and 1 ice tea, and I paid over $35??? The panini is no more than $8 each, plus an ice tea, $35? Then, my son went to the counter, picked up the food and asked the lady about it. She looked into the computer and then realized she pushed the wrong button. I was overpaid by $8. I'm happy I got the money. Later, the lady came to our table and apologize for the mistake she did. I thought that was kinda nice. I bet she already said sorry to my son, so it wasn't necessary to apologize to me again. I really appreciate for her attitude. Well, the panini was so delicious. It was big. I thought I was going to save the other half for later, but we all ended up finish everything. It was so good, that I forgot to take a picture!! Any way, we will definitely go back for Salmon panini and coffee drinks.
author: The Black Cat C.

description: Cute cafe with wifi. Parking in the area isnt' great. Had the quite and it didn't have much flavor. great service though.
author: Tiff W.

description: It's nice this cafe but prices seem steep esp for sunset Merced area. Coffee string but nice.
author: obgyn K.

description:
Great coffee.  

Great yogurt parfait with fresh cut strawberries.

Awesome service.
author: Lauren T.

description:
Close to City College, BLUE BOTTLE COFFEE FOLKS!

Nice Staff, Good Atmosphere for studying, Great food (bit overpriced), yummy pastries, and good accessible WIFI 
Nothing bad to say about this place, recommend this place to anyone
author: Mary D.

description:
I've been to fog lifter a couple of times, not because I chose to, but because my friends were raving about blue bottle coffee. 

If you want something quick and fast, this is not the place to go. Thankfully, the times I've been here, I had to work for a couple of hours. The reasoning behind my thinking is that because they take so long to produce mediocre coffee and food. Yes, the food is pretty fresh but every time I order a sandwich or a bagel, they are always out of my first choice... Really??? The blue bottle coffee was also mediocre and sloppily served... After all the hype I've read, this place doesn't deserve it.

Service was less than mediocre. Okay, I get it, hipsters hang out here, but do hipsters servers have to be a snob and apathetic to the customers. Every time they took my order,  I can sense that they think they are too cool to be taking patrons' orders. I, the customer, has to muster up that energy and smile to make myself feel better and maybe put a smile on the barista's face.

I tried and I did give the establishments multiple chances before I decided to write such an unsatisfactory review...
author: Anette N.

description: This cafe is conveniently located right by the yoga studio which is great should I ever require a substantial pick me up afterwards. I haven't wandered in here too often but the service has been solid but the chai latte is a bit too sweet to make it a go-to drink.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Had a great Cafe Latte here with a croissant sandwich 
I like they way the did drip coffee here.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Others' complaints are that the staff is not friendly and extremely rude.  I think this is an understatement - they take no prisoners!  "Huh" is a popular entry in their limited vernacular. They don't know how to properly drip coffee.  And can't tell you the county of origin.  They used to serve Blue Bottle before they ended wholesaling.  Too bad, because no one knew how to prepare it.  They have served me stale - as in "HARD" - baked goods.  I ordered a soup once . . .  the owner said it was very good.  It may have been "very good" about a month before I ordered it; the texture was mush.  (I can take exception since I do have functioning teeth, in sufficient quantity).  I asked the barista - the type you wouldn't take home to meet mama - if I need a key for the rest room.  She is no slave to fashion and I think she hides a whip under her apron.  "It's closed, we have to clean it, there are only two of us . . . I don't know when it opens . . ."  Not what my kidneys wanted to hear.  She obviously had gestapo training. 

I think the staff is docked half pay if they smile.

Not my idea of what a cafe should be.  Adios amigos . . .
author: Richard D.

description: Got a drip coffee and granola with yogurt and fruit.. If I could have it every day I would. The coffee was great and the granola was fresh and amazing. Great independent coffee shop!
author: RN S.

description:
Great place to study, blue bottle coffee, free wi-fi, tasty sandwiches and a lot of different snacks to choose from.

Too bad they close early.
author: M W.

description: I have no complaints about this spot. It's great to have a spot like this that I can walk to in less than 5 minutes. Staff is super cool and they know how to make coffee; whether a drip or espresso drink, they do it well. What makes this spot really special, are the people that work here and are regulars. I WFH, so I have made this my second office. I finally tried the McLifter and it was delicious.
author: Eucalyptus J.

description:
The name Fog Lifter Cafe is somewhat of a misnomer. The fog is settling around the coffee shop as I type this.

Even though they should rethink their name, this coffee shop is a decent place to sit and drink a cup of coffee. Most of the tables only seat two people, so it is probably best on your own or with a friend and not a big study group. Plenty of people sitting on their laptops or reading the newspaper. Bonus: power outlets that are reachable from most of the tables.

Blue Bottle drip coffee is $2.25, while not the cheapest cup of coffee, the slow drip is a nice touch.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
I'm really sad about how things are going at Fog Lifter Cafe. I still go, but have learned to not do anything on the internet there because it frequently kicks you off and I recently lost a lot of work. 
Also, the coffee, particularly the drip is very bitter. Not sure why.

Sad face.
author: Dbs B.

description: Always see this place when going to the gym. Finally came with my friend after dinner across the street. We were greeted upon arrival which is a refreshing thing to experience. I ordered the blueberry monster but was told that they couldn't make the monster and instead offered a mixed berry substitute. Not bad but would still have preferred a full blueberry drink. My friend got a latte which tasted a little coffee bitter to me. All under 8 bucks.
author: Alex T.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood,  Fog Lifter Cafe!  I stopped by this morning...opening day... and it's immediately apparent the new owner has done a great job of modernizing the place! (formerly Kings Coffee)  Airy, bright...plenty of tables inside and out.. free wi-fi, plasma t.v, newspapers, and a very energized team behind the counter!      Absolutely delicious pastries ( I swooned over their fabulicious apricot crumb cake) and they feature Blue Bottle Coffee!    More blends arriving soon (including a special Turkish blend with frest mint coming I'm keen on sampling) said the charming owner/barrista  who made my coffee this a.m!    

The Fog Lifter Cafe is located on the corner of Ocean & Ashton Aves....just across the street from the 24 Hour Sport on Ocean Ave! This place should do well with the foot traffic, the gym members and SFSU and CCSF just blocks away!

Check it out!!!!
author: Karen S.

description: That is some great coffee, and the smoked salmon avocado sandwich rocked. Best part was the word 'smile' written in the foam of my latte. I was forced to follow its instruction...
author: Robert H.

description: Excellent and convenient coffee shop on an otherwise bleak stretch of Ocean Ave. Staff is uniformly friendly and professional and there's usually tons of space if you're looking to linger. Vegan cookies are a plus.
author: Albert S.

description:
Man, I am so bummed to write this review but I wanted to share my experience.

I've been SO EXCITED for Fog Lifter to open up!  I live right up the street and I planned on making it my daily morning stop on my way to work.

I went in a week or two ago and my excitement promptly fizzled.

I walked up to the counter and there were only two other customers in there-- a girl on her laptop at a table, and a guy ordering at the counter in front of me.  I stood behind him a bit, and looked over the menu while I was waiting to be helped.

The guy in front of me wasn't buying anything, it turns out.  He was standing there chatting with a man I have to assume is the owner.  He was standing at the cash register, but he was going on and on about how fresh his ingredients are and how proud he is of his cafe, so I'm pretty sure he's the owner.

Cool, I'm all for pride in your work!

So I wait.  And wait.  And I'm being completely ignored by the owner who is so into talking about how his cafe is the best place in the world that he can't even say hello to me or ask one of the guys behind the counter to help me.  So I wait more.  And wait.  And wait.

Finally one of the other workers noticed me and took my coffee order.  He was super friendly and nice, cracking jokes while he helped me.  I liked that.  The one star in this review is for that guy.

What I didn't like was all this time the owner STILL hasn't even acknowledged I'm there, and the poor guy helping me had to physically MOVE the owner out of the way in order to ring me up.

Oh, and the icing on the cake?  The owner was SLAMMING other local businesses.  It's one thing to be proud of what you do and your cafe, but he did NOT need to mentally go down Ocean Ave and put down almost every single other business on the street, naming names and saying you're so much better than they are.  Real classy.

That was my first impression, and it will also be my last.  I won't be stepping foot in there ever again, I'll simply take my daily business elsewhere.  (You know, to one of those other local business that were talked about so unprofessionally!)
author: Tamara N.

description:
I am still loving this place! I stopped by recently and enjoyed another wonderful cup of coffee and opted for a ham and cheese croissant. All was fabulous. I grabbed a table and knocked out a paper for class. 

The atmosphere is picking up here! The staff was quick and efficient, everything looked fresh, and the place is spotless! This place looks top notch from the outside too, especially at dark. Glad the neighborhood is getting more options with this level of quality and service. 

I'll keep coming back!
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I've gone back MANY times after my horrendous 4th of July experience.  I was REALLY angry that day.

But things have gotten better.  I stick with their Three Africans drip coffee and it's always solid.  One time I messed with a latte and iced coffee.. it wasn't all that great.  Plain cup of joe does it for me!

Their, "big oat bar," is delicious.  It's a dry, not too sweet, and kinda plain (sounds kinda bland, huh? No...it's good!!)  which I really like with my coffee! Yum!
author: anita h.

description:
Stepped in here today to get coffee. Lots of hip kids on their Macs, typing away. Friendly baristas, and plenty of seating.

Blue Bottle coffee! :)
author: Tiffany L.

description: This place is awesome. The staff is very kind and genuine. They go the distance to help you create whatever you'd like (even stuff not on the menu) great food!
author: Erik B.

description: Pretty much my favorite cafe in the city.  I love the coffee, the food, the staff is always friendly and there are comfortable places to sit.  This is important to me.  Maybe more important than it should be, but here I am.
author: James F.

description:
Very nice new place! There are two decent coffee places along Ocean, and this is one of them (the other is Java on Ocean). Their coffee and mochas are perfect, and the ambiance and setting is nice. It feels very open and inviting just when you're walking in, and the food they offer (though somewhat limited says my friend), is good, and made fresh. Because of this however, the service can be a little slow. It took a very long time for them to toast a bagel and put cream cheese on it when I went a few weeks ago, and I'm not sure if they've been able to speed it up at all.

I'm optimistic however that any negative things (both in their service speed, and things said in the other reviews), will hopefully be resolved. This is a new business and kinks are going to be there to be ironed out. For what it's worth, this is a place to try.
author: Betsy W.

description: One of my favorite cafes in the city! I like this cafe a lot, indeed, I have been so many times the employees are all very nice to the clients. I always order either a Chicken Panini or a Spinach and mushroom Quiche and I have never been disappointed with the food. They also have a great selection of pastries, cookies, muffins and other fattening delicacies that have been forcing me to stop by the 24 hour fitness around the corner - I need to burn those extra calories I get every time I visit this cafe. Those pastries are so tempting, at least in 3 or 4 occasions I was on my way to the gym and I decided to stop to grab a coffee and I ended up having coffee and cookies or other items and my plan to go to the gym was cancelled. I can blame them for the extra pounds I have put on during the last weekss, aside that, this coffee shop is among the best ones in the Bay Area.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Good place to get sandwiches and coffee. 

We work at home and the power went out a few months ago, and we simply moved to Fog Lifter and waited the power outage out. 

The owner is really nice too and often takes your order and brings you your food.
author: Jeremy B.

description: I just keep finding myself back here. Why?! Well It  must be their killer coffee and laid back attitude. I swear I fell asleep here the other day and no one cared! Haven't really tried their food. This place used to be King's coffee shop about a year ago and that place was mediocre at best. The way they micro filter their coffee here makes the lattes super creamy and delish. Also it's right next to the best soup place in the 'set Pho Ha Tien! Hmm I  think I'm getting an idea for another review...
author: Matteo C.

description:
Nice coffee shop on Ocean Ave. Clean, great coffee, lots of tables, good smoothies, and well lit work area. This is definitely better than the other coffee shops on Ocean.  Their staff is always ready to help, but they can working on their approachability and sincerity.

It seems that most of their things are a bit over priced.  On one occasion, I got a Vitamin Water there and was surprised they charged me $2.25 for the same size bottle that sells for around a dollar elsewhere.  On another occasion, I got a mocha and, although it was good, it was over priced.

Cleanliness, free wifi, and a good location definitely gives it 4 stars.
author: Joe Y.

description: Walking distance from my brothers' house. Love visiting here for a delicious cappuccino and kids hot chocolate for my girls. Upscale touches without the cost! Very nice!
author: Gemilyn R.

description: They get 4 stars just for having Blue Bottle Coffee.  No fancy flavors just great coffee. My daughter & I shared the tuna pannini. The bread was toasted nice & crisp on the outside, warm & buttery on the inside. The tuna was full of flavor & not overly mayo-ed(yes, my word)to death. Interior of shop was very simple & neat. Newspapers to read, wi-fi to use or people to talk to. Glad to have a NEW coffee place other then the large chain places that think they make a good cup coffee.
author: M G.

description:
Went in here 4 the first time today not bad altjough they were out of blue bottle coffee the owner assured me that he had something equally good. Not crowded came after hitting up 24 hour . The owner was pretty nice we chatted for a bit he has another cafe on cole st . It is nice to see something that has organic food & fresh salads in the hood.

I will be back again....But ehhh step it up & order more coffee he sold out on the weekend it's monday Imma hit it again in the morning and we shall see
author: Kim R.

description: My first visit to this nice local cafe was exceptional! They have a down to earth feel, and I appreciate the great customer service. I didn't wait long to order and they brought my order to my table. They are quaint in size, but I like that they are smaller and also not a chain cafe.
author: Cristin C.

description:
While waiting to get my haircut next door, I decided I need a pick me up for the morning. 

I ordered a mocha. The coffee in the mocha was a little watered down/not strong, but the beans were a perfect roast: not bitter at all, and flavorful. Chocolate flavor was slight but good distinct hint. It appears they use dark chocolate shavings. I would say the mocha is a bit over priced, but looking at the menu, everything else is actually really cheap (coffee only menu).

Overall, it wasn't bad. Not the best mocha I've had, but I would come back to try their other coffee drinks. Like a lot of the coffee shops in the city, they specialize in organic/fair trade blends. They also carry Blue Bottle, which is awesome.
author: Marc T.

description: I understand the stuff is expensive but reusing grounds for multiple pour overs? I mentioned how sour my coffee tasted, who knows how many pour overs my grounds had seen, and was told "you can always buy something else".  Coffee snobbery on Ocean? Misplaced.
author: Stanley J.

description:
Fantastic atmosphere, sunny and clean and very relaxing. 

The internet is free, and so far very reliable. Lots of plugs along the wall. Perfect spot to get some work done while enjoying a coffee or sandwich.

The coffee and food are both great. I'll be back for sure. 

Very well put together considering it just opened. Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: James F.

description:
This place serves blue bottle coffee and have a big open seating area. The coffee is good because it's blue bottle but lacks that coziness that you want in a rustic/ antique/ broken couch coffee shop that I find comfortable. The space is so open that u can hear everyone talking. I was the one catching up with my friend so I felt disruptive to all the rest of the people that were studying. 

Overall, a good experience but just not good enough to get a 5 star.
author: Hei Ming C.

description: Very nice black and white mocha, good wifi and a diverse (though yet, for me, untried) menu of food options.  The MUNI K train stops 1 block away at Ocean and Dorado / Jules, or it's about a 12 minute walk from the Balboa Park BART station along Ocean Ave.  Inside is clean, well-lit (even on a foggy day) with not-too-loud music playing.  I would caution laptop lovers out there that there aren't any terribly many plugs, though if you sit anywhere along the edge of the room you'll find a plug within about 6 feet.  Highly recommended!  Open till 8pm every night.
author: Paul L.

description: I come here literally every weekend. This cafe is one of my favorite places in the city to relax and study. The environment is nice and chill, the staff is awesome, and the food is to die for. If you're a coffee addict or a college student this place is TOTALLY for you.
author: Alex J.

description: Cool staff, good coffee, lots of space and chairs and VEGAN cookies! Also vegan option falafel which I haven't tried yet but really cool place seriously.
author: Sara G.

description: I still love Fog Lifter, and the service here is great. I do miss the breakfast burritos though!
author: S E.

description: I live around the corner from this place, I m a big fan.
author: Alyssa S.

description: meh...coffee grinds in an iced coffee nasty, so-so sandwiches and salads
author: Long C.

description: I like the atmosphere of this place, though I'm a bit disappointed with the strength of the chai latte. The flavor was super mild and I'm being honest when I say that I'd prefer a much stronger spice flavor. Maybe it was a fluke?
author: Alexandra R.

description:
I get coffee from here at least twice a week. Staff is always pleasant, coffee is great. 
However, Sunday 8/11,  was a little different. Instead of my usual drip coffee, I ordered 2 sandwiches to go. It took 20 minutes from ordering to receiving my order. 20 minutes!!! 
On top of that, I saw one of the baristas (short asymmetrical blonde hair, tattoo back of her neck) keep touching her hair and her face and then would handle drinks without washing her hands.
author: Melissa P.

description:
My favorite coffee is mocha and blue bottle coffee makes an excellent mocha. I was excited for the neighborhood to finally have a blue bottle coffee place, but I was totally disappointed. Fog Lifter Cafe may have "blue bottle coffee", but it's no where near as the quality of the blue bottle coffee places downtown.

My mocha was pretty bland, bitter, and didn't have the nice artistic drawing. Not that the drawing matters in terms of taste. It's more for show that skill and care went into preparing the coffee.
author: Steven B.

description: I love this place! Great coffee made by people who obviously care about coffee, healthy snacks (including smoothies the way I make them at home, just fruit, juice and yogurt---what else!?) friendly staff and relaxing atmosphere. I'm a nanny for a little boy with autism and I always feel welcome here.
author: Gabriella V.

description: I had to update this post. I have returned since my last post and they have way improved. The staff is friendly and the espresso was tasty and effective. They have a lot of space for studying or working on your computer which is also nice.
author: Heather T.

description: I made my own bagel, tomato, avocado sandwich... :)- Quite place to work and good background music.
author: Sam B.

description: This place will always be a little extra special for me because it was the first place I found to retreat to when I was brand new to the city. This place has delicious blue bottle coffee and a variety of espresso drinks that are perfect for a foggy day. They also have really delicious food options! The egg and cheese croissant was a buttery breakfast indulgence that I would gladly have again. My favorite part about this place is how genuinely friendly the employees are! Every time I am there, the people brighten my day. I would definitely recommend this place of you're looking for a great little neighborhood coffee place with its own character.
author: Shannon P.

description: I came here a few times (once after I got my tattoo next door and the second time after visiting the tattoo shop next door again lol).  Love their white mocha and they also make great sandwiches. I've been to the coffee shop that's across the street from them or down the block from them. Eh, not that great.
author: Lily W.

description:
My first visit to Fog Lifter Cafe. Opted to come here due to my recent disappointment at the Peet's in West Portal.  

I walked in, the place looked nice and first thing I noticed was the proudly serving Blue Bottle Coffee.  Their 1st star, I ordered a mocha, soy milk with light chocolate and an almond croissant.  Giving 2nd star for having my fave pastry. The cashier was friendly 3rd star, they offered gluten free cookie for my dear friend Hilary, 4th star and when I got my drink....to my amazement there was a bear face wearing a bow tie made on top! 5th star!! 

Omg, this made my day and the drink was delicious!!

I'm a fan and coming back!
author: Michelle B.

description:
I love this place! Very close to home and conveniently located across the street from 24 fitness.  

The Chicken Cesar sandwich is really yummy.

Its a cool place to sit back and do work (free wifi) while appreciating the view of the dense fog outside.
author: Anthony Xavier S.

description: It was pretty in-and-out for me, but my friendly barrister hand-poured water through one of the melitas lined up in a row, with my selected coffee. So, it was a fresh, custom-made cup. It was a little bitter in the end, but I appreciated the strength and unique way this was made. It certainly wasn't my father's diner coffee.
author: Michael G.

description: Anywhere with blue bottle coffee is a winner in my book! One random day, I needed a place to study and kill time and this cafe catered to all my study needs. There's a large space with plenty of seating, outlets, blue bottle coffee, food and free wifi. It was a modern, yet comfy space with nice people and calm music. I would definitely come visit again if i'm ever "stuck" around the area!
author: Kelly S.

description: Come for the Chai Tea latte or blue bottle brewed coffee. Very comfy, spacious neighborhood cafe.
author: Farah S.

description: Love this place. I am a coffee addict, I've tried it all. I mean it when I say this place is a gem with the best iced coffee in my opinion. Plus the staff is super friendly and the vibe here is just really nice. Check it out!
author: Mel H.

description: Great coffee shop.  Their food is good too.  Also there is a parklet just outside which is a nice addition to the place.
author: Annabelle K.

description: This is my go to cafe in the neighborhood. It's clean, modern, and friendly. They sell  Blue Bottle coffee, have free wifi, and there are plenty of outlets for your laptop! The food is okay, nothing to rave about. I recommend the Vegan Falafel, Hummus sandwich and the iced coffee (Warning: this drink is highly caffeinated). They also have a wide selection of cold drinks if you want something other than coffee.
author: Donna W.

description:
I love their coffee, it's excellent.  Nice atmosphere for somebody who would like to grab a coffee and read a magazine.  I wouldn't exactly consider it to be studying friendly.
The service doesn't seem to friendly but I would come here again
author: Bobby L.

description: Needed a quick breakfast...checked out yelp for nearest, decent place! WOW! Wasn't sure about it at first... Thinking is there enough options? Well, yes there are! And the service is fabulous!!! These guys make you want to come back! Oh! Did I mention the coffee! I've heard Blue bottle coffee is great and now I can say it IS great!
author: Halina Y.

description:
The bagels are toasted and creamed, just right. Perfect

They make really great cakes and croissants as well. Definitely try the pumpkin spice cake. I think that's what it was. With chocolate chips in it. Mmmmmm Yummm!
author: Yaj R.

description:
Spacious and airy with its high ceilings and ample seating, the cafes interior has a good, welcoming vibe. The sandwiches are filling and delicious, if a bit over-priced. The coffee is truly wonderful. They always take the time to put adorable designs like cats and bears into your mochas lattes, which I certainly appreciate. For those who don't drink coffee, Fog Lifter offers a yummy hot chocolate and a wide selection of herbal teas. 

I've been coming here to study for almost a year now and I've mostly been pleased with my experiences here; outlets are plentiful, seating isn't usually hard to find, and the the noise-level is tolerable. However, lately I must complain that they've been pumping up the volume a tad too much on the music. It's to the point where you can't even hold down a conversation. I appreciate their selection of chill-out cafe notes, but hey, tone it down! Even with earplugs I can hear the speakers-a-blaring! 

The main reason this review gets only 3 stars instead of a solid 5 is the music. Fog LIfter, if you keep your music volume turned down to a reasonable level then you'll get better reviews :)
author: A W.

description: I just ordered a breakfast croissant from this place and soon after consuming my meal discovered the egg was rotten. I lost my meal, several times,  all over Ocean Avenue on my way home. The egg was GREEN on it's way back up. Never coming back. I should have just gone to Whole Foods.
author: Stephanie M.
