description: Great coffee, friendly staff, yummy sandwiches at lunch time. And pleasant outdoor seating. I see a couple reviewers said the coffee is too intense. (It's Blue Bottle, people. It's actual coffee, not Folgers. Add a little water if you must.) Anyway, I like this place and its mellow vibe.
author: Warzie L.

description: I had my worst and most disguising iced coffee here. I ordered one iced coffee an it was THICK with coffee bean sediment inside my coffee. I ask for a replacement, the second one looked fine but tasted AWFUl. I had their regular coffe before and it was good. I don't know what's wrong with thei iced coffees
author: Michael C.

description: This place is awesome. The staff is friendly and always happy to be working. Once they even gave me a coffee when I realized I did not have cash on me.
author: Brenden C.

description: Really nice service and delicious food! I love the drip coffee! I'm giving 4 stars because it's overpriced
author: Simi J.

description:
They have a sign at the register that reads "no cell phones when ordering" or something to that effect. Makes a lot of sense, it's rude when customers try to order while on the phone. It was ironic that with that sign posted the girl behind the counter was completely ignoring me while she was at the register totaling receipts or something. No I'll be right with you or even eye contact to let me know she sees me and she will help me when she's done. A guy came from behind the counter to help me and as he went to use the register to charge me, the girl still wouldn't get out of the way so he could provide me with good service even if she didn't. I ended up feeling like my business was bothering her. As I consumed my purchase I couldn't help but notice that all other employees seemed pretty nice while she remained indifferent to other customers. At least she made time to chat with and be friendly towards her coworkers. It would be nice, and good business if she treated her customers the same way.

Now the food, I had an awesome turkey and provolone sandwich the first time I came, it was pretty good. I ordered it again another time and it was terrible. It was made with different bread, little to no cheese, and I swear the first time it had some sort of pesto mayo or something like it that made it taste delicious, the second one-plain and dry. On another occasion, I met up with a friend who was having quiche served with salad. It was great, the spinach salad had goat cheese crumbles and I could see on the sliced tomato that it had been salted and peppered. Since I ended up eating half of my friends food, I got up and ordered another quiche no more than 10 minutes since the first was ordered, totally different experience. The quiche was the same but there was no cheese on the salad and no salt or pepper on the tomato. Bland! 

In summary, food is hit or miss (apparently due to lack of consistency or attention to detail from the too cool for school hipster staff), service sometimes okay sometimes makes you feel like you are bothering them if you need to be acknowledged.
author: erika e.

description: Coffee here is good but what gets the 5 stars is the really cute girl at the cash register that does an excellent job pretending to give a shit about what's going on in your life. Thanks, you're the best!
author: Kendog ..

description: Nice little local cafe. They serve Blue Bottle coffee, which is organic and fair trade, and also very yummy. The milk they use is also organic, so even tho it is a bit pricy, you get a good bang for your buck. The people are friendly, and on Sundays, there is live music. Definately my new favorite coffee spot.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Nice place to get a cup of coffee and sit there to get your work done. there are free wifi and the downloading speed is good. It is pretty crowded on Saturday and Sunday Afternoon.
author: Li L.

description: I live right around the corner and took way too long to try this place. Went in while my best friend was visiting from out of town. We each got bagels, she got a coffee and I a tea. Everything was great. The best part was that both of the employees working were incredibly nice, conversational, and inspired me to want to return. I really like the overall atmosphere of the place. Can't wait to return! Thanks guys. :)
author: Stacey J.

description: Had a iced coffee today. It got some weird taste. Even though it was only like $2, I couldn't finish it because it tasted nasty. Seriously, how could mess up the most basic iced coffee.
author: Evan L.

description:
I really want to love this place because it's so close to my house, and the decor is nice, and the place is always clean. BUT, I went there today and there were two apathetic barristas who obviously would rather be ANYWHERE else doing nothing (like picking out hipster-sweaters) than doing nothing behind the counter of this cafe.  

I had not eaten all day, so I wanted to order a bagel sandwich for lunch, but they ran out of bagels (really, that's half of the menu?!), so I ordered a vegan falafel and hummus sandwich. It took the sandwich over 25 minutes to appear even though the place was entirely empty when I arrived.  I also had ordered a famous "blue bottle drip coffee" and 30 minutes after ordering, I went up to ask where my coffee was and the guy said, "oh, I forgot" to make it. Nice. So I had to wait 10 more minutes for the coffee.  So, just a 40-minute wait for a small coffee and a 25-minute wait for a sandwich when the place is empty.  Awesome service guys!  They were literally standing there just staring blankly into space.  I spent $9 for these two items.

Finally, a few people wander in and they also wait at least 15 minutes (to 25) for their coffee.  This is so striking, that I say aloud, "wow, this is the first coffee shop I've ever been to where no one has a coffee in front of them."  SO, 6 people just sitting in their seats waiting and waiting endlessly. For coffee. Wow.  I so want to go to Starbucks right about now!

So then comes the sandwich. Ugh. Really, really terrible.  The "bread" is actually a wrap, not panini bread as advertised (they just panini press it)  and the falafels are re-fried to a burnt crisp in really old (bitter) oil and taste VERY foul.  They overdid the tahini and not enough hummus, so overall, the sandwich is the most bitter item I have ever paid to eat.  It was 1 pm, so out of starvation & convenience, I ate it anyway.  To top it off, the sandwich sent me straight to the bathroom in a bad way 15 minutes after eating it.  You think that's a coincidence?  By BF went straight to the bathroom 10 minutes after just taking a few bites. They should call it a bullet sandwich.  So it was like buying a $7 enema. :-p

DO NOT VISIT THIS PLACE unless you have 20 minutes to waste waiting for a small cup of coffee or you really need to end your bout of constipation FAST.  

Both stars above are solely for the look of the place itself, which is nice. Zero for service and product.  By the way, the first time I came here, I was buying a coffee a few minutes to nine on my way to work...BIG MISTAKE! I had to cancel it as ten minutes later, no coffee in sight. Half of the slowness is the workers' fault: they just don't care.
author: Lisita P.

description:
to be quite honest, i RARELY go around the ingleside/CCSF area, but this cafe made me think twice. and also, my friend is one of the baristas here, so you better be nice!

a pretty spacious cafe with awesome seating and selections. plus, they serve blue bottle, which is awesome considering that around the area, it isn't the 'mecca' of gourmet coffee goodness. just saying! 

a must try= FALAFEL WRAP. it filled me up and they give you a generous portion of it.
author: Marc K.

description:
I wish this place was around earlier.  It was great coming here when I was working from home and needed to get a new setting for work with some free wifi.  The coffee is excellent and they put effort into the process.  The owner is super nice and the shop has a nice, warm atmosphere to it.

Aside from the coffee, their sandwiches are excellent.  The North Beach in particular was surprisingly delicious.  The only downside is that it's a little pricier due to the high quality of their food and drink, but it's all worth the price.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Finally walked down to this highly spoken of coffee spot and I was a bit disappointed. My Western Scramble everything bagel was dry and flavorless. I'm used to the personal drip cup coffee, but the setup is poorly executed. The coffee drops from pretty high and splashes all over the side of the paper cup (I would rather have had a ceramic coffee cup), the coffee was good enough, but having to get up and see if my coffee was ready was really annoying. Standing around watching it drop didn't seem like a good plan, there were 3 cups up there and not sure which one was mine. When it was finally ready, the splash on the cup was a mess. My spouse got sick after her croissant egg sandwich, so I won't be going back.
author: Nadia M.

description: Loved their coffee, which they brew each cup. WiFi is a bit slow, but ok with me.
author: Mike M.

description: New! Old King's Coffee Shop is now the Fog Lifter Cafe. We are so happy they are here. I had an excellent espresso macchiato. They just opened today 1901 Ocean Ave. corner of Ashton, across from the Astronomical Society of the Pacific. Please welcome them to the neighborhood, Kenneth
author: Kenneth F.

description:
What is Wong with Cafes claiming to serve Blue Bottle coffee and instead churning out mediocre run of the mill espresso. 

I so wanted to love this place. Ocean avenue needed a decent coffee hangout. I came here a few times when Fog Lifter opened and the owner was making the Caps and Lattes and they were pretty good. Obviously he had been trained by Blue Bottle. It had what I wanted - not too hot creamy and not bitter. 

I have been back 3 times in the last month at it has become progressively worse. Clearly the barista's have NOT been trained. No attention to detail. Scalding hot, bitter and Starbucks foam. Not what i paid $3.50 for! 

I hope the owner reads this and understands that you cannot just throw a blue bottle logo on your window and produce shite coffee. Well at least they got the prices right.
author: Hud B.

description: My Wife and I stopped in for coffee and found this nice local coffee shop. Spacious and populated by the usual suspects along with one time visitors like ourselves. Though we enjoyed the local flavor the coffee was brewed by adding hot water to the grind in a filter held by a funnel with the cup a few inches below. This allowed the water to drip freely into the waiting cup. Nice idea however the coffee ends up tepid at best as it cools on its way to the cup. Granted this was a cool SF day but aren't most Summer days like this? Since I stay away from Microwaving if possible, this would have been the only way to make my coffee HOT!. The inventory of sweet rolls etc. had been picked over by the early crowd no doubt as we struggled to find something to have with our coffee that we liked. We also noted the servers were having conversations that were continued until completion while we waited to give our orders and again as we came to the counter to get our coffee. Some on site management, customer policies and alternative brewing techniques would help this establishment. Good luck, Michael M.(SF Native).
author: Michael M.

description: Cute place for people watching while wired on blue bottle single drip coffee! There's also large enough space to do work without feeling suffocated by fellow caffeinated creatures. Plus the option of choosing your own (free) music is not too shabby.
author: Karen H.

description: Def my favorite coffee place around campus. For City College students, this place is as good as it gets, the coffee is well made, the place is wide and very environmental friendly, the staffs are kind and friendly plus a great place to study! Im def happy with the coffee i get, i also ordered the organic garden variety salad, which was well made and healthy too....the only downside is that the place is a little far from campus....but def will be here again when i have to study!
author: Cavin T.

description: I like the feel in here.  I like to come in for a cup of coffee and sometimes a bagel or muffin and read or chat with friends.  Staff is very friendly and likable. Sometimes they make cool designs on my mochas ($4).  I don't think the coffee drinks served here are the best I've had (but I'm not someone who knows a lot about coffees, I'm just referring to my preference), but they're quality coffees, made well.  Blue bottle coffee, wi-fi, good sunlight in the mornings, friendly staff, right across the street from 24 Hour Fitness Gym.  nice..
author: A T.

description: New Orleans Ice Coffee. Nice open area. Friendly staff.
author: Wayne Z.

description: Still a great place! Great ambiance and great food although the coffee is not something I like, its good coffee i just personally have my own bias about where i buy my coffee from but this has to be a GREATT sandwich!
author: Hubert L.

description: Best coffee on ocean avenue and nice, open atmosphere inside.
author: Kim K.

description:
I'm so happy to see this cafe open in my neighborhood! Welcome! This, plus the soon to come whole foods in the former Kragen site are going to do a lot for scrappy Ocean Ave.

Jouad (I'm probably misspelling his name) has put a lot of effort into fixing up the old King's cafe into a contemporary, blue-bottle slinging establishment. 

It's tastefully painted and full of light. There is wood flooring and a lovely wide countertop. I'm told there might be a parklet in the works, which would be fantastic!

I'm thrilled that he's serving blue bottle, using Roman Espresso as the house bean, and 3 Africans for the drip. He's selling bagged beans as well. 

The pannini menu looks interesting, I will have to try that soon.

I'd love to see proper, thick brown earthenware cups and saucers (like they have in Italy or at other blue bottle cafes, as it retains the heat really nicely. The walls could probably use some art (local art!, yay!), but overall, I'm really looking forward to spending a bit of time in my newest local cafe!
author: A P.

description: Stopped in on my way from the dmv, needed a nice treat for myself and was famished. I can't say how nice it is to walk into a coffee shop and be greeted with a smile instead of a scowl. When I couldn't decide what to munch on, a suggestion was made. The atmosphere is relaxing and homey. My almond milk chai was perfect and so was my falafel with avocado. I'm happy I stumbled in. If I'm down this way again, I'll be back. 5 NOM stars.
author: Laura H.

description: I like this place, great open atmosphere & can't go wrong with Blue Bottle coffee. My first visit was a bit weird, employee was a bit unfriendly, but every time since service has been great & professional.  Keep up the good work staff.
author: Kyle H.

description: TheFogLifter is right across the street from my house, which is bad for me. Bacause their coffee is great, their tea is great, their sandwiches are great, their panini's are great, i mean...how do they get everything so right? they have an awesome staff and great atmosphere.
author: Cassandra L.

description: Thanks for opening up! I love this new cafe. They have great blue bottle coffee and nice staff. Its very spacious and clean and there is a ton of room to study or relax on couches or at tables. They also have free wi- fi and lots of bike parking!
author: M K.

description: This cafe is a new discovery for me.  The friendly staff serves drip Blue Bottle coffee, and I must say that this coffee is now one of my new favorites in the city.  Definitely good enough to drink black - no cream required.  The great space and free Wi-Fi seal the deal.  The next time you are driving down Ocean Ave, check it out.
author: Wayne H.

description: This is my local coffee shop and I love it.  Working bathroom, outlets for laptop, nice baristas, almost always you can find a seat, etc, etc.  5 stars!
author: Max H.

description:
The first time I came here I ordered an egg and cheese croissant and a tea. I took a few bites before I started to read my book. It was very tasty, so I ended up eating it all before I delved into the world of Murakami. Then, as I was reading my book, I started coughing uncontrollably, out of nowhere. I wondered what the cause was until I realized that the whole cafe had filled up with a smoky feeling from all the sandwiches that were being made. I was the only one coughing, which made me feel like an anomaly, so I tried to move to another area of the cafe that had better ventilation. As it turned out, wherever I sat, I had the sensation to cough. At one point, I was relieved to see the door opening to let air in. I couldn't open the door and leave it open because it was one of those cold and windy days in San Francisco, where if I tried to open the door, the customers would likely give me the death stare. I couldn't take it anymore, so I had to leave that place.

I still go back occasionally. It's a nice and wide coffee shop, and the tables are nicely spaced, such that everyone can get their own corner and not be bothered. I wish they did something about that smoky feeling though.
author: Jenny L.

description: I went in here craving a sandwich one day...I ordered a chicken with avacado and they ran out of chicken so I substituted salami...best sub of meat ever, and now I am hooked....it is close to home, cool vibe and really brings a lot to the neighborhood...will be back soon...
author: Ryan A.

description: Good food and coffee. Live music too!
author: Daniella O.

description: Bagles are good, but way over priced. I love the Blue Bottle Coffee though!
author: Alex G.

description: this place is great! The new owner really fixed it up and now they serve blue bottle! Big plus
author: Prentice S.

description: So I absolutely love having a decent cafe in my neighborhood. But, in the spirit of improvement, please make sure that the lattes are served nice and hot. Great place, can't wait to try the food. Really, Ingleside REALLY needed this place. Java coffee is terrible!
author: Michelle S.

description: Nice and convenient to where I live AND finally I can get a decent cup of coffee by my house. So far its been consistent. Can't say its my favorite "by the cup" coffee place...(philz has that place in my heart) but its good.
author: tee c.

description: I used to love this place - quiet, great location for studying, right across from my gym, and plenty of cute guys.  Today a woman with a small 5lb dog came in for coffee, tied her dog to a chair, and ordered her beverage.  I'm not a dog hater - as a matter of a fact, I have a 90 lb long haired cuddly rottweiler who I adore. But I would NEVER - N E V E R - bring her to an establishment that serves food because her fur flies everywhere.  Not only did this woman enjoy her drink and read a book for well over an hour, but one of the young male employees ran over during a slow moment to pet the dog and returned to work without washing his hands.  My own dog's fur in my food is tolerable because I know where she's been.  But would I pay for it? Not a chance.  Really disappointed. I'd come back to study, but will not be purchasing drinks or food.
author: ashley d.

description: Lou's, Roxie's, etc...Could Fog Lifter be among these greats?  After a local "casualty (another sammy place in the area closed down)," we decided to try the sammies at Fog Lifter.  We ordered the hot pastrami with avocado and salami paninni...both decent sammies, but unfortunately, I was not blown away. If you've ever read my reviews, I'll say it once, and I'll say it again, how I evaluate many sandwich places (first) is by the hot pastrami.  There was nothing "wrong" with the sandwiches.  It just merely appeared like a flavor of Vanilla compared to chocolate gooey goodness, or some other hipster, outlandish flavor they have these days.  If you want something seemingly traditional and you are at the shop studying/doing work, this is not a bad choice.  If you are on the hunt for the best sandwich in the city, let's continue to run around and eat together!
author: Steph W.

description: This is the best coffee shop in the neighborhood! It's located across the street from the 24 hour fitness, for that evening tea or tasty roast beef sandwich and other tasty pastries. I highly recommend this friendly establishment to everyone and you will not be disappointed.
author: Vincent J.

description: It's alright. Not much of a coffee drinker so I'm not the best judge, but it was fresh and it did the job.
author: M R.

description: Blue bottle coffee on good ole' Ocean Avenue with an owner with a heart of gold--YES!
author: Elle S.

description: This place gets two stars for the upscale look but they're coffee is weak, bitter and overpriced. They advertise "Blue Bottle Coffee" and I really don't get what the hype is all about.  A "large" coffee is a Starbucks tall and is $2.25. Don't waste your money.
author: Chris B.

description: Very nice cafe. The staff is friendly, and the interior is very nice and spacious.
author: Keith A.

description: I'm a big fan of their New Orleans Iced Coffee, smoothies, and sandwiches.  It's a great place to work or study, the wifi is free, and the bathrooms are clean.  It's also conveniently located across from a 24 hour fitness and a pretty good Vietnamese restaurant, and close to a MUNI stop (for the K/T routes).
author: M. N.

description: I loved my espresso, cappuccino, latte and individually brewed coffee and each was a work of art. The Blue Bottle Coffee logo caught my attention at first, and the espresso drinks were made with the same skill, art and love that other shops of its kind are noted for. The place also has a casual hang-out atmosphere, the sandwiches are exemplary too, and the baristas aren't snobs.
author: Marion H.

description: welcome to the hood! good people making a go of it. Let's support them. Just up the tea game: brew the iced tea unsweetened and get some more brands of hot tea bags.
author: hunter w.

description: I've worked from here two days now and really like it! Delicious Blue Bottle coffee makes for a lovely, roasted-smelling almond milk latte. They have yummy pastries and sandwiches as well. The ambiance makes for a nice, professional-yet-laid back vibe. The big windows let in a lot of light even in this neighborhood. Wi-fi is free with no limit like the cafe down the street (last I went there years ago, there was a time limit which makes working from there difficult). There are a few outlets to plug into, and while the parking is metered right along Ocean, you can usually go around the corner to Urbano or Ashton and find something non-metered there. The staff are all cool, and the guy who I think is the owner is super-friendly. Deducting one point for a bathroom that isn't on par with the rest of the establishment. There were enough supplies and it's not gross or anything, but not tended to as often as the rest of the place, and it's kind of dark which lends a kind of dingy air to it. But that's my only complaint. Overally, really nice place.
author: Deb T.

description: Fresh Food Fast! Try this place you will like it. My favorite is their Soup with Salad or a Panini. This place is very clean. They scored 100% on their Health Report.
author: Sheri S.

description: Cute little cafe. Took my kids there for hot chocolate and the barista did amazing art right in the cup: drew two little kittens with the foam!
author: maria b.

description:
i want to write something positive, but it is hard.  have been here many times after working out at 24 hour fitness which is opposite.  it is pretty clean and they the atmosphere is nice.  unfortunately, the negatives far outweigh the positives and i hope the owner figures this out

1.  most of the staff is borderline incompetent, slow and surly and wouldn't get past the first two minutes of a starbucks interview
2.  if the coffee is blue bottle then they really know how to mess out making good coffee.  half of the time the coffee lukewarm
3  wifi works well when it works, but 20% of the time the router is down, and the staff usually tells you that it is a problem with your laptop
4. don't order the food.  go across the street to get a decent (vietnamese) sandwich

sorry for the bad vibes i am giving off.  like others have mentioned, i hope starbucks opens nearby
author: James C.

description: Blue Bottle coffee, great food, friendly staff and a lot of cozy space inside and outside to hang....
author: Les L.

description: I like the exterior and interior of this cafe. It's very sunny and spacious inside. It's ZEN like. The menus are easy to read. I was not hungry so I just had coffee and toasted bagel with butter. Very nice. Simple and very affordable. I can say that from a teacher's salary!
author: Magdalena D.

description: The Fog Lifter Cafe is amazing! It is so refreshing to see a new business open up especially in this economy. The coffee is wonderful, staff friendly and the owners are very hands on within the shop. I highly recommend Fog Lifter Cafe if you are looking for a delicious cappuccino (my favorite) and some quite time to yourself. Coffee has always been a love of mine and Fog Lifter Cafe has never let me down!
author: Teresa V.

description: i love this place... i came once and and the second time i came around they remember my  drink. they great with customer service super nice! great selection of food and pastries. and i love their coffee its nice smooth and bold coffee flavor.  i do wish it open later like till 11pm but thats never possible with any good cafe. i just love a late cafe. not to mention the cafe is huge spacious and great atmosphere. i also wish there was free wifi so thats a downer.
author: Thaleda C.

description: This place has great chai and it's a great place to study or just hang out with friends. I love the casual atmosphere and the sandwiches are great too! On the other hand, sometimes staff members get confused on which order was for whom. If this could be more organized, then I would give this place 5 stars. The live music on Sundays is just okay. The band is great but the singer is okay.
author: Palina P.
